original: @1b #// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: @1b #// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa /
translated: Fortieth Chapter🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽how should bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi; ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi; ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: How should they accomplish the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji @2a *// ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bgyi lags /
analyzed: ji @2a *// ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bgyi lags /
translated: How should they cultivate the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs zhi ba dang / gzugs ya ma brla dang / gzugs gsog dang; gzugs snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs zhi ba dang / gzugs ya ma brla dang / gzugs gsog dang; gzugs snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, because form is peaceful, because form is unreal, because form is empty, because form is insubstantial, you should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba dang / rnam par shes pa ya ma brla dang / rnam par shes pa gsog dang / rnam par shes pa snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad @2b par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba dang / rnam par shes pa ya ma brla dang / rnam par shes pa gsog dang / rnam par shes pa snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad @2b par bya'o //
translated: consciousness is without a self.

original: gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: “Moreover, if someone were to ask, ‘How should one practice the perfection of wisdom?’

original: zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: zhes zer ba ni /
translated: one should reply, ‘Space is empty.

original: nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be practiced by accomplishing the emptiness of space.’

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par bgyi /
translated: Moreover, if someone were to ask, ‘How should one cultivate the perfection of wisdom?’

original: zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: zhes zer ba ni /
translated: one should reply, ‘Space is empty.

original: nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid bsgom pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid bsgom pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be cultivated by cultivating the emptiness of space.’🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yun ring po ji srid cig tu spyad na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yun ring po ji srid cig tu spyad na /
translated: For how long have bodhisattva great beings practiced the perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa lags /
translated: For how long have they practiced the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /🔽byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu @3a #//
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste / byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu @3a #//
translated: from the first production of the thought of awakening

original: phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //🔽de ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: phyin pa la spyad par bya'o // de ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: up to sitting on the seat of awakening, they should practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽They should accomplish it like that.

original: de ltar bsgom par bya'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci sems kyi rgyun ma chad cing /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom par bya'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci sems kyi rgyun ma chad cing /
translated: They should meditate on it like that.”

original: ma bral bar rjes su 'brel pas spyad par bgyi lags sam /
analyzed: ma bral bar rjes su 'brel pas spyad par bgyi lags sam /
translated: He said, “Lord, is it by the uninterrupted and unbroken continuity of the mind that they should practice?”🔽“Lord, is it by the uninterrupted and unbroken continuity of the mind that they should practice?”

original: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: yid la byed pa gzhan dag gi go skabs mi dbye bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa gzhan dag gi go skabs mi dbye bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: they should practice the perfection of wisdom without giving an opportunity to other mental activities.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa mi dor bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa mi dor bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya zhing /
translated: “You should practice the perfection of wisdom without giving up the attention on omniscience.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya /
translated: You should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: You should meditate on the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mi rgyu ba de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mi rgyu ba de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: You should practice the perfection of wisdom in such a way that the phenomena of mind and mental factors do not occur.

original: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par @3b bya'o; ;de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par @3b bya'o; ;de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: You should accomplish it in that way. You should meditate on it in that way.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags sam /
translated: “Lord, is it by practicing the perfection of wisdom, by accomplishing the perfection of wisdom, by meditating on the perfection of wisdom that bodhisattva great beings will attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no; ;gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no; ;gsol pa /
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das 'o na ma bsgoms pas lags sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'o na ma bsgoms pas lags sam /
translated: “Lord, then is it by not meditating?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”

original: 'o na bsgoms kyang bsgoms la; ma bsgoms kyang ma bsgoms pas lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na bsgoms kyang bsgoms la; ma bsgoms kyang ma bsgoms pas lags sam /
translated: “Lord, then is it by meditating and not meditating?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na bsgoms pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na bsgoms pa'ang ma lags /
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”

original: ma bsgoms pa'ang ma lags pas lags sam /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa'ang ma lags pas lags sam /
translated: “Lord, then is it by neither meditating nor not meditating?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: 'o na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags; bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags; bka' stsal pa /
translated: how then is the knowledge of all aspects attained?”🔽The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: just as suchness is.”

original: gsol pa / de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “What is suchness like?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “Just as the limit of reality is.”

original: gsol pa / yang dag pa'i mtha' ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / yang dag pa'i mtha' ji lta bu lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “What is the limit of reality like?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: chos kyi dbyings ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “Just as the realm of phenomena is.”

original: gsol pa / chos kyi dbyings ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / chos kyi dbyings ji lta bu lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “What is the realm of phenomena like?”

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽bdag gi @4a *//
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / bdag gi @4a *//
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Just as the realm of self is,

original: khams ji lta ba dang / sems can gyi khams ji lta ba dang / srog gi khams ji lta ba dang / gang zag gi khams ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: khams ji lta ba dang / sems can gyi khams ji lta ba dang / srog gi khams ji lta ba dang / gang zag gi khams ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: the realm of sentient beings is, the realm of life is, and the realm of persons is.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; bdag gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams kyi bar dag ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; bdag gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams kyi bar dag ji lta bu lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, what is the realm of self up to the realm of persons like?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: bdag gam sems can dag dmigs su yod snyam mam /
analyzed: bdag gam sems can dag dmigs su yod snyam mam /
translated: “Do you think that a self or a being can be apprehended?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: no, I do not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor; bdag gam sems can dmigs su med na; ji ltar sems can gyi khams gdags par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor; bdag gam sems can dmigs su med na; ji ltar sems can gyi khams gdags par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, if a self or a being cannot be apprehended, how can the realm of beings be designated?

original: rab 'byor / de ltar sems can du 'dogs par mi byed /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar sems can du 'dogs par mi byed /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, beings are not designated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang 'dogs par mi byed /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang 'dogs par mi byed /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not designated.

original: chos thams cad du'ang 'dogs par mi byed /
analyzed: chos thams cad du'ang 'dogs par mi byed /
translated: All phenomena are not designated.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” He asked, “Blessed One,

original: ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: is the perfection of wisdom not designated?”

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, and the perfection of moral discipline?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: And is the perfection of generosity also not something to be labeled?”

original: rab 'byor / shes @4b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdags su med pa yin no //🔽'dus byas sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes @4b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdags su med pa yin no // 'dus byas sam /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is not something to be labeled.

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: Whether conditioned or unconditioned,

original: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
translated: whether the qualities of the hearers,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: the qualities of the solitary buddhas,

original: chos thams cad kyi bar dag kyang gdags su med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar dag kyang gdags su med pa yin no //
translated: or all phenomena, they are not something to be labeled.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad gdags su ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad gdags su ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are not something to be labeled,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du sems can dmyal ba gdags su mchis par gyur /
analyzed: ci'i slad du sems can dmyal ba gdags su mchis par gyur /
translated: why are the hells something to be labeled?

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas gdags su mchis par gyur /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas gdags su mchis par gyur /
translated: the animal birth would be designated,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gdags su mchis par gyur /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gdags su mchis par gyur /
translated: the world of Yama would be designated,

original: mi dang lha gdags su mchis par gyur /
analyzed: mi dang lha gdags su mchis par gyur /
translated: humans and gods would be designated,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gdags su ma mchis par gyur lags /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gdags su ma mchis par gyur lags /
translated: up to the designation of stream enterer, up to the designation of pratyekabuddha, and the designation of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening would be designated.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

original: sems can du gdags pa dmigs su yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa dmigs su yod snyam mam /
translated: is the designation of a being to be apprehended?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it is not.”🔽The Lord said,

original: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: sems can dmigs su med na /
analyzed: sems can dmigs su med na /
translated: if a being is not apprehended,

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i bar dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag ji ltar gdags par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / lha dang / mi dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i bar dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag ji ltar gdags par bya ste /
translated: How could the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts, and the realms of gods, humans, stream-enterers, up to worthy ones, solitary buddhas, and perfect buddhas be designated?🔽Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @5a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @5a *//
translated: bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: de ltar gdags su med pa'i chos rnams la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gdags su med pa'i chos rnams la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in those dharmas that cannot be designated.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” “Lord,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la bslab par bgyi lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la bslab par bgyi lags sam /
translated: then should bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom train in form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la bslab par bgyi lags sam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la bslab par bgyi lags sam /
translated: train in feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bgyi lags sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bgyi lags sam /
translated: “Should one train in the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs la dor ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs la dor ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, one should train in form without subtracting and without adding.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dor ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dor ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the knowledge of all aspects without subtracting and without adding.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; ji ltar dor ba ma mchis pa dang / bsnan pa ma mchis par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bgyi lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; ji ltar dor ba ma mchis pa dang / bsnan pa ma mchis par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bgyi lags /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One, how should one train in the knowledge of all aspects without subtracting and without adding?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,

original: rab 'byor / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, one should train without production and without cessation.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked,

original: ji ltar gzugs la skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi /
translated: “Blessed One, how should one train in form without production and without cessation?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: How should they train in the knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: mngon @5b par 'du bya ba med pa ste /🔽'du byed rnams bsgom par yang mi bya /
analyzed: mngon @5b par 'du bya ba med pa ste / 'du byed rnams bsgom par yang mi bya /
translated: He replied, “Subhūti, they should train in the absence of production and the absence of cessation.

original: gzhig par yang mi bya bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhig par yang mi bya bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: They should train in not cultivating and not destroying conditioned things.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: ji ltar mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis par bslab par bgyi lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis par bslab par bgyi lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: how should they train in the absence of production?

original: rab 'byor / chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mthong bas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mthong bas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: He replied, “Subhūti, they should train in the absence of production by seeing that dharmas are empty of their own marks.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par ji ltar bslab par bgyi lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par ji ltar bslab par bgyi lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord, how should they train in the emptiness of their own marks of all dharmas?

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: He replied, “Subhūti, they should see form as empty of form.

original: tshor ba ni tshor bas stong par blta'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni tshor bas stong par blta'o //
translated: They should see feeling as empty of feeling.

original: 'du shes ni 'du shes kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'du shes kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: perception is to be seen as empty of perception.

original: 'du byed rnams ni 'du byed rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni 'du byed rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: volitional factors are to be seen as empty of volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong par blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong par blta'o //
translated: consciousness is to be seen as empty of consciousness.

original: mig gi bar ni mig gis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: mig gi bar ni mig gis stong par blta'o //
translated: up to the eyes are to be seen as empty of eyes.

original: yid kyi bar ni yid kyis stong par blta'o //🔽nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: yid kyi bar ni yid kyis stong par blta'o // nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: up to the mind is to be seen as empty of mind.🔽inner emptiness is to be seen as empty of inner emptiness.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: up to the emptiness of its own mark is to be seen as empty of the emptiness of its own mark.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni bsam gtan rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni bsam gtan rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: the meditative absorptions are to be seen as empty of the meditative absorptions.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas stong par blta'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas stong par blta'o //
translated: up to the meditative absorption of cessation is to be seen as empty of the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: the applications of mindfulness are to be seen as empty of the applications of mindfulness.

original: byang chub kyi bar ni byang chub kyi bar gyis @6a *//
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar ni byang chub kyi bar gyis @6a *//
translated: Up to enlightenment is up to the stage of enlightenment.🔽

original: stong par blta ste /
analyzed: stong par blta ste /
translated: up to enlightenment is empty of enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in all phenomena empty of their own marks.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: gal te gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
translated: if form is empty of form,

original: byang chub kyi bar yang byang chub kyi bar gyis stong lags na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar yang byang chub kyi bar gyis stong lags na /
translated: up to enlightenment is empty of enlightenment,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par ji ltar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par ji ltar 'gyur lags /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / spyod pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / spyod pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, not practicing is the bodhisattva great beings’ practice of the perfection of wisdom.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci'i slad du spyod pa ma mchis pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du spyod pa ma mchis pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags /
translated: Why is the practice of the perfection of wisdom a non-practice?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: Subhūti, it is because they do not apprehend the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a bodhisattva,

original: spyod pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: spyod pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend practice,

original: gang la spyod pa dang / gang gis spyod pa dang / gang du spyod pa de'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang la spyod pa dang / gang gis spyod pa dang / gang du spyod pa de'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: and they do not apprehend the one who practices, the practice, or the place of practice.

original: rab 'byor / de gang la spyod pa de dag thams cad mi dmigs pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de gang la spyod pa de dag thams cad mi dmigs pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, when they do not apprehend any of those practices, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te spyod pa ma mchis pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / gal te spyod pa ma mchis pa /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags na /
translated: if the practice of the perfection of wisdom is a non-practice,

original: bcom @6b ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom @6b ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: 'o na las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
translated: “Well then, how should a beginner bodhisattva practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Subhūti, here a beginner bodhisattva should, from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening,

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i chos thams cad la bslab par bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i chos thams cad la bslab par bya zhing /
translated: train in all phenomena in that way, without apprehending anything.

original: des sbyin pa sbyin pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: des sbyin pa sbyin pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: When they give gifts, they should give gifts without apprehending anything.

original: tshul khrims srung ba na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o //🔽bzod pa sgrub pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ba na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o // bzod pa sgrub pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: When they guard morality, they should guard morality without apprehending anything.🔽When they cultivate patience, they should cultivate patience without apprehending anything.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
translated: When they make an effort, they should make an effort without apprehending anything.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: When entering into the meditative stabilization, one should enter into the meditative stabilization in a manner of non-apprehension.

original: shes rab sgom pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab sgom pa na mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab bsgom par bya ste /
translated: When cultivating wisdom, one should cultivate wisdom in a manner of non-apprehension.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same goes for up to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji tsam gyis na mi dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na mi dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: to what extent is there non-apprehension?

original: ji tsam gyis na dmigs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na dmigs par 'gyur lags /
translated: To what extent is there apprehension?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ji tsam du gnyis yod pa de tsam du dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du gnyis yod pa de tsam du dmigs pa ste /
translated: “To the extent that there is duality, there is apprehension.

original: gnyis su med pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Non-duality is non-apprehension.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gnyis zhes bgyi ba gang lags /
analyzed: gnyis zhes bgyi ba gang lags /
translated: what is duality?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mig dang gzug @7a *//
analyzed: mig dang gzug @7a *//
translated: “From the eye and form,

original: kyi bar dang / yid dang chos kyi bar dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar du ste /
analyzed: kyi bar dang / yid dang chos kyi bar dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar du ste /
translated: up to the mind and mental objects, up to awakening and buddhahood—

original: rab 'byor / de ni gnyis so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni gnyis so //
translated: Subhūti, that is duality.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gnyis su ma mchis pa gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gnyis su ma mchis pa gang lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, what is nonduality?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mig dang gzugs kyi bar du med pa dang / yid dang chos rnams kyi bar du med pa dang / byang chub dang sangs rgyas kyi bar du med pa ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs kyi bar du med pa dang / yid dang chos rnams kyi bar du med pa dang / byang chub dang sangs rgyas kyi bar du med pa ste /
translated: “It is the absence of the eye and form, up to the absence of the mind and mental objects, up to the absence of awakening and buddhahood.

original: rab 'byor / de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is nonduality.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: ci dmigs su ma mchis pa mi dmigs lags sam /
analyzed: ci dmigs su ma mchis pa mi dmigs lags sam /
translated: is it that the nonapprehensible is not apprehended,🔽or is it that duality is not apprehended?”

original: 'on te gnyis su mchis pa mi dmigs lags bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis su mchis pa mi dmigs lags bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / dmigs su yod pas mi dmigs pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dmigs su yod pas mi dmigs pa'ang ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, it is not that the apprehensible is not apprehended,

original: dmigs su med pas mi dmigs pa'ang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dmigs su med pas mi dmigs pa'ang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: nor is it that the nonapprehensible is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / 'on kyang dmigs su yod pa dang; dmigs su med pa mnyam pa nyid ni dmigs su med pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'on kyang dmigs su yod pa dang; dmigs su med pa mnyam pa nyid ni dmigs su med pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, however, the nonapprehensibility of the apprehensible and the nonapprehensibility of the nonapprehensible are the same.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa mnyam pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa mnyam pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the sameness of the apprehensible and the nonapprehensible.”

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who train like that will be without reference points in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: gsal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /🔽dmigs pa la mi chags shing /
analyzed: gsal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa / dmigs pa la mi chags shing /
translated: it is clear that bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽are not attached to reference points

original: mi dmigs pa @7b la'ang mi chag pa lags na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa @7b la'ang mi chag pa lags na /
translated: and are not attached to nonreference points.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi /
translated: complete the levels?

original: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis nas kyang ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bgyi lags /
analyzed: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis nas kyang ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bgyi lags /
translated: And having completed the levels, how do they attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni dmigs pa la gnas shing sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par mi byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni dmigs pa la gnas shing sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par mi byed de /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom do not complete the stages while dwelling on objects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /🔽dmigs pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas / dmigs pa la gnas nas /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽cannot complete the stages

original: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus so //
translated: while dwelling on objects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang dmigs su med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang dmigs su med la /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is also not an object,

original: byang chub kyang dmigs su med cing /
analyzed: byang chub kyang dmigs su med cing /
translated: enlightenment is also not an object,

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'ang dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'ang dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: and one who practices the perfection of wisdom is also not an object.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang dmigs su ma mchis /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang dmigs su ma mchis /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended,

original: byang chub kyang dmigs su ma mchis /
analyzed: byang chub kyang dmigs su ma mchis /
translated: enlightenment is not apprehended,

original: gang byang chub kyi slad du spyod pa de'ang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi slad du spyod pa de'ang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
translated: and one who practices for the sake of enlightenment is also not apprehended,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @8a *//
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @8a *//
translated: then, Blessed One, how should bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: la spyod pas ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i chos thams cad la 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: la spyod pas ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i chos thams cad la 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: distinguish all phenomena, which are devoid of intrinsic nature, saying, ‘This is form,

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
translated: this is feeling,

original: 'di ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes so //
translated: this is perception,

original: 'di ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: this is volitional factors,

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: this is consciousness,

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi bar ro //🔽zhes ji ltar rab tu rnam par dbye bar bgyi lags /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi bar ro // zhes ji ltar rab tu rnam par dbye bar bgyi lags /
translated: and this is enlightenment’?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽should distinguish all phenomena, which are devoid of intrinsic nature, saying, ‘This is form,🔽this is feeling,🔽this is perception,🔽this is volitional factors,🔽this is consciousness,🔽and this is enlightenment.’

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ji ltar byas pas gzugs dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar du dmigs pa dang / byang chub kyi bar du dmigs par 'gyur ba de ltar chos rnams la rab tu rnam par 'byed par mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ji ltar byas pas gzugs dmigs pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar du dmigs pa dang / byang chub kyi bar du dmigs par 'gyur ba de ltar chos rnams la rab tu rnam par 'byed par mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not discern phenomena in such a way that they would apprehend form, up to apprehend consciousness, up to apprehend awakening.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend form,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang mi dmigs /
translated: up to do not apprehend consciousness,

original: byang chub kyi bar du'ang mi dmigs la gnas na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du'ang mi dmigs la gnas na /
translated: up to do not apprehend awakening, and abide in that,

original: 'o na ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing /
translated: then how do they complete the perfection of generosity

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: and enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par zhugs nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par zhugs nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid par 'gyur lags /
translated: Having entered into the faultlessness of a bodhisattva, they will purify a buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyis nas kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyis nas kyang /
translated: Having purified a buddhafield,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid par 'gyur lags /
translated: they will bring beings to maturity.

original: @8b sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyis nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: @8b sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyis nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags /
translated: Having brought beings to maturity, they will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob nas kyang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob nas kyang /
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur lags /
translated: they will turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas kyang /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas kyang /
translated: Having turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bgyid par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bgyid par 'gyur lags /
translated: they will perform the activities of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bgyis nas kyang sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar par bgyid par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bgyis nas kyang sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar par bgyid par 'gyur lags /
translated: Having performed the activities of a buddha, they will liberate beings from saṃsāra.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs kyi ched du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs kyi ched du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of form.

original: byang chub kyi bar gyi ched du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar gyi ched du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of awakening.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: 'o na gang gi ched du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi ched du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags /
translated: then for whose sake do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gang gi ched du'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gang gi ched du'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi byed do //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings do not practice the perfection of wisdom for anyone’s sake.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma byas pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma byas pa /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all phenomena are unproduced,

original: chos thams cad ni 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: all phenomena are unchanging.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa yin la /
translated: That perfection of wisdom is also unproduced and unchanging.

original: byang chub kyang ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: byang chub kyang ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa yin zhing /
translated: because awakening is not made and is unchanging,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and because a bodhisattva is not made and is unchanging.

original: rab 'byor / @9a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / @9a *//
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: thus should bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, by way of not making and not changing anything.🔽”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad ma bgyis pa dang / 'gyur ba ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ma bgyis pa dang / 'gyur ba ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: if all dharmas are not made and do not change,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: 'o na ji ltar theg pa gsum po nyan thos kyi theg pa dang; rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'di dag rnam par dgod par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar theg pa gsum po nyan thos kyi theg pa dang; rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'di dag rnam par dgod par 'gyur lags /
translated: then how will the three vehicles—the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and the Buddha Vehicle—be differentiated?🔽”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod pa gang yang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod pa gang yang dmigs su med de /
translated: in dharmas that are not made and do not change, no differentiation can be apprehended at all.

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / mngon par bsags pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod pa dmigs su yod do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / mngon par bsags pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod pa dmigs su yod do //
translated: “The phenomena that are created and accumulated are perceived as being established.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni phung po lnga la mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni phung po lnga la mngon par zhen te /
translated: Because immature, ordinary people who are not learned cling to the five aggregates.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: They cling to the aggregate of form,

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar la mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar la mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: they cling to the aggregate of consciousness,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: up to they cling to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs la rlom sems su byed /
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems su byed /
translated: They falsely project form,

original: gzugs la dmigs par byed /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs par byed /
translated: they objectify form,

original: byang chub kyi bar la rlom sems su byed /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar la rlom sems su byed /
translated: up to they falsely project awakening,

original: byang chub kyi bar du dmigs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du dmigs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: up to they objectify awakening.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag mthong na bdag ni byang chub mngon par @9b rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag mthong na bdag ni byang chub mngon par @9b rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They think, ‘When I see, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: bdag gis sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar bya'o //🔽snyam du sems so //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar bya'o // snyam du sems so //
translated: I will liberate all sentient beings from cyclic existence.🔽”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs dang / byang chub kyi bar gang yin pa dag ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan lngas kyang ma dmigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs dang / byang chub kyi bar gang yin pa dag ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan lngas kyang ma dmigs na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, do not apprehend in the five eyes even form and so on up to awakening.

original: skyes bu blun po sangs rgyas la skur pa 'debs pa de dag ni sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar par bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu blun po sangs rgyas la skur pa 'debs pa de dag ni sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar par bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those foolish people who slander the Buddha want to liberate sentient beings from cyclic existence.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas kyang sems can gang dag 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar bgyi ba dag ma dmigs lags na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas kyang sems can gang dag 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar bgyi ba dag ma dmigs lags na /
translated: if the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Completely Enlightened Ones, do not apprehend in the five eyes any sentient beings to be liberated from cyclic existence,

original: 'o na nga bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ji ltar sems can rnams yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / ma nges pa'i phung po gsum du lung bstan par mdzad lags /
analyzed: 'o na nga bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ji ltar sems can rnams yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / ma nges pa'i phung po gsum du lung bstan par mdzad lags /
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, how is it that you, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, have given a prophecy of three groups of beings—those who are destined for the authentic, those who are destined for the inauthentic, and those who are not destined?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / ngas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I have not apprehended any beings at all who are destined for the authentic,🔽destined for the inauthentic,

original: log pa nyid du nges pa'am /🔽ma nges pa'i sems can 'ga' yang ma dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa'am / ma nges pa'i sems can 'ga' yang ma dmigs mod kyi /
translated: or not destined.

original: rab 'byor / @10a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / @10a *//
translated: Subhūti,

original: 'on kyang sems can rdzas med pa la rdzas su 'du shes pa 'di dag ngas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang dag pa ma yin pa la 'jig pa de las bzlog gi /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can rdzas med pa la rdzas su 'du shes pa 'di dag ngas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang dag pa ma yin pa la 'jig pa de las bzlog gi /
translated: nevertheless, I have turned those beings, who are not substantial but have the notion that they are substantial, away from the destruction of what is inauthentic, even conventionally,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Bhagavān,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas don dam pa la bzhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas don dam pa la bzhugs te /
translated: did the Tathāgata, abiding in the ultimate,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood?”🔽He replied, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: that is not so.”

original: gsol pa / 'o na rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam grangs la bzhugs te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags bsam /
analyzed: gsol pa / 'o na rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam grangs la bzhugs te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags bsam /
translated: He asked, “Well then, did he attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, abiding in a magical creation?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: that is not so.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te don dam pa la bzhugs te /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang ma lags la /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / gal te don dam pa la bzhugs te / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang ma lags la /
translated: He asked, “Bhagavān,🔽if he did not attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, abiding in the ultimate,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam grangs la bzhugs te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam grangs la bzhugs te /
translated: and he did not attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, abiding in a magical creation,🔽then, Bhagavān,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang ma lags na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang ma lags na /
translated: If it is not the case that the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas have manifestly and completely awakened to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'am /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags grang /🔽bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang @10b dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags grang / bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang @10b dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa ma yin te /
translated: then, Tathāgata, Arhat, Genuinely Perfect Buddha, would it not be the case that they have not manifestly and completely awakened to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment?🔽”🔽The Blessed One replied, “Su­bhūti, the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas have manifestly and completely awakened to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas mod kyi /
translated: and, Su­bhūti, the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas have manifestly and completely awakened to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
translated: It is the compounded element.🔽🔽

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la'ang gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la'ang gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not stand in any compounded element or uncompounded element.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la'ang mi gnas mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la'ang mi gnas mod kyi /
translated: The emanation of a tathāgata does not stand in any compounded element or uncompounded element.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa'ang yod la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa'ang yod la /
translated: However, that emanation of a tathāgata has going, coming, standing, sitting,

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and it practices the perfection of generosity, the perfection of good conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,🔽and the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang /
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom, accomplish and abide in the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the five kinds of clairvoyance, the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la bsgom pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nang @11a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la bsgom pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nang @11a *//
translated: and the eightfold noble path. They cultivate the meditative stabilization of emptiness, the meditative stabilization of signlessness, the meditative stabilization of aspirationlessness,

original: stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: inner emptiness, up to the emptiness of its own mark, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: snying rje chen po la sgom zhing /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la sgom zhing /
translated: and great compassion.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gyur la /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gyur la /
translated: and he had turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: sprul pa des kyang sems can dpag tu med pa dag sprul nas /
analyzed: sprul pa des kyang sems can dpag tu med pa dag sprul nas /
translated: and that emanation had emanated countless sentient beings,

original: phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur na /
analyzed: phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur na /
translated: and had prophesied them to the three vehicles,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think, Subhūti?

original: sprul pa des sems can 'ga' yang phung po gsum du lung bstan pa yod snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: sprul pa des sems can 'ga' yang phung po gsum du lung bstan pa yod snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / de ni ma lags so //
translated: Would that emanation have prophesied any sentient beings to the three vehicles?”🔽He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur mkhyen te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur mkhyen te /
translated: “Subhūti, similarly, the Tathāgata knows all phenomena to be like an emanation.

original: sprul pa de lta bur mkhyen nas sems can gang yang btul ba med do //
analyzed: sprul pa de lta bur mkhyen nas sems can gang yang btul ba med do //
translated: Having known them to be like an emanation, he has not guided any sentient beings at all.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should cultivate the perfection of wisdom like the Tathāgata’s emanations.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad sprul ba lta bu lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad sprul ba lta bu lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are like an emanation,

original: bcom ldan 'das; de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sprul ba la bye brag ni ci mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sprul ba la bye brag ni ci mchis /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the difference between the Tathāgata and his emanation?

original: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci mchis /
analyzed: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci mchis /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: dgongs pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is the intention?”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das @11b kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das @11b kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni bye brag ci'ang med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni bye brag ci'ang med de /
translated: “Su­bhūti, there is no difference at all between the Tathāgata and the emanation of the Tathāgata.

original: tha dad du bya ba ci'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ci'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: No distinction can be apprehended at all.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni bye brag med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni bye brag med do //
translated: Su­bhūti, there is no difference between the Tathāgata and the emanation of the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'phrin las gang mdzad pa de ni sprul pa'ang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'phrin las gang mdzad pa de ni sprul pa'ang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because the Tathāgata performs whatever activity the emanation performs.”🔽He asked:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs na /
analyzed: ci de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs na /
translated: if the Tathāgata is not present,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul ba sug las bgyid lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul ba sug las bgyid lags sam /
translated: does the emanation of the Tathāgata perform any activity?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byed do //
translated: “Subhūti, it does.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs na /
translated: “Lord, if the Tathāgata is not present,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa sug las ji ltar bgyid lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa sug las ji ltar bgyid lags /
translated: what work does the Tathāgata’s magical creation do?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa blo gros zhi bas byang chub sems dpa' ma dmigs nas /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa blo gros zhi bas byang chub sems dpa' ma dmigs nas /
translated: For example, the Tathāgata Śāntamati, not apprehending a bodhisattva,

original: sprul pa sprul nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: sprul pa sprul nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: emanated an emanation and then passed into Nirvāṇa.

original: sprul ba des kyang phyi na bskal pa las lhag par sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas te /
analyzed: sprul ba des kyang phyi na bskal pa las lhag par sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas te /
translated: That emanation did the work of a Buddha for a hundred eons after that.

original: des phyis byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das 'da'o //
analyzed: des phyis byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das 'da'o //
translated: After that, having prophesied a bodhisattva, it passed into Nirvāṇa.

original: zhes skye bo rnams kyis kun tu shes kyang sprul pa la ni skye ba med /
analyzed: zhes skye bo rnams kyis kun tu shes kyang sprul pa la ni skye ba med /
translated: Even though people knew that, the emanation was not born and

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang med de /🔽rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang med de / rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: did not pass into Nirvāṇa.🔽Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: should not apprehend

original: chos thams @12a *//
analyzed: chos thams @12a *//
translated: any dharma at all.

original: cad sprul ba lta bur mos par bya zhing /
analyzed: cad sprul ba lta bur mos par bya zhing /
translated: One should consider all of them to be like magical incarnations,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: and one should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te sprul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag ma mchis na /
analyzed: gal te sprul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag ma mchis na /
translated: if there is no difference between a magical incarnation and a tathāgata,

original: sbyin pa yongs su sbyong bar yang ji ltar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su sbyong bar yang ji ltar 'gyur lags /
translated: how can there be purification of generosity?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽sems can gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba de dag ni phung po'i lhag ma ma mchis pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur gyi bar du nam yang bas par mi 'gyur lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / sems can gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba de dag ni phung po'i lhag ma ma mchis pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur gyi bar du nam yang bas par mi 'gyur lags na /
translated: Blessed One,🔽those sentient beings who offer gifts to a tathāgata will never be exhausted until they have passed into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa that has no substratum left.

original: bcom ldan 'das; de bzhin du sems can gang dag gis sprul ba la yon phul ba de dag kyang phung po'i lhag ma ma mchis pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur gyi bar du na ma yang bas bar mi
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; de bzhin du sems can gang dag gis sprul ba la yon phul ba de dag kyang phung po'i lhag ma ma mchis pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur gyi bar du na ma yang bas bar mi
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, those sentient beings who offer gifts to a magical incarnation will never be exhausted until they have passed into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa that has no substratum left.

original: 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: “Subhūti, is it not the case that the Tathāgata is not one thing and the emanation another?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / chos nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i chos nyid de nyid kyis sprul pa'ang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i chos nyid de nyid kyis sprul pa'ang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, just as the Tathāgata is the field of merit for the world with its celestial beings, so too is the emanation the field of merit for the world with its celestial beings.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba lta'ang zhog /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba lta'ang zhog /
translated: “Subhūti, set aside the offering made to the Tathāgata.
