original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la yon phul ba lta'ang zhog gi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la yon phul ba lta'ang zhog gi /
translated: Set aside the offering made to the emanation of the Tathāgata.

original: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis @12b byams pa dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byed na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis @12b byams pa dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byed na /
translated: “Subhūti, if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to attend to the Tathāgata with loving kindness,

original: de dag thams cad ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i mthar ma phyin par sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i mthar ma phyin par sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: all of them would reach the end of suffering without finishing that wholesome root.

original: rab 'byor / byams pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa lta'ang zhog gi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byams pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa lta'ang zhog gi /
translated: “Subhūti, set aside the attention with loving kindness.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Son of noble family,🔽

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byas shing nam mkha' la me tog snyim pas gtor na; de dag thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i mthar ma phyin par sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byas shing nam mkha' la me tog snyim pas gtor na; de dag thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i mthar ma phyin par sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Subhūti, if any sons or daughters of good family, with the Tathāgata in mind, were to toss handfuls of flowers into the sky, all of them, without exhausting that wholesome root, would reach the end of suffering.

original: rab 'byor / byams pa dang ldan pas yid la byed pa lta'ang zhog /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byams pa dang ldan pas yid la byed pa lta'ang zhog /
translated: “Subhūti, put aside the mental states associated with loving kindness.

original: nam mkha' la me tog snyim pas gtor ba lta'ang zhog gi /🔽rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' la me tog snyim pas gtor ba lta'ang zhog gi / rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Put aside tossing handfuls of flowers into the sky.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal bar byed na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal bar byed na /
translated: “Subhūti, if any sons or daughters of good family were to pay homage to the Buddha,

original: de dag thams cad kyang rim gyis sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rim gyis sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: all of them would gradually reach the end of suffering.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba ni de ltar mthu che ba dang / de ltar phan yon che ba yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba ni de ltar mthu che ba dang / de ltar phan yon che ba yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, offerings made to the Tathāgata are thus very powerful and have such great benefits.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid tshad mar byas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid tshad mar byas na /
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations it should be understood that, having taken the dharma-mark of dharmas as authoritative,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la bye brag cung zad kyang med par rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la bye brag cung zad kyang med par rigs par bya ste /
translated: there is not the slightest difference between a Tathāgata and a Tathāgata emanation.

original: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should practice the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid la zhugs nas /🔽chos nyid de'ang rnam par dkrugs @13a *//
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid la zhugs nas / chos nyid de'ang rnam par dkrugs @13a *//
translated: Having entered into the dharmatā of dharmas,

original: par mi bya ste /
analyzed: par mi bya ste /
translated: they should not disturb that dharmatā.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: This is the dharmatā of the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes rnam par dkrugs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes rnam par dkrugs par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not disturb it, thinking,🔽‘This is the perfection of wisdom,’ or ‘This is the dharmatā of the perfection of wisdom.’

original: chos thams cad kyi bar dag la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar dag la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to all dharmas up to and including omniscience.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: gal te chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs par mi bgyi lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs par mi bgyi lags na /
translated: “Lord, if the thusness of phenomena is not to be disturbed,

original: bcom ldan 'das; gang gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; gang gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: then why, Blessed One, did the Tathāgata say, ‘This is form,

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar ro zhes bgyi ba dang / de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar ro zhes bgyi ba dang / de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams kyang bka' stsal /
translated: this is up to consciousness,’ and likewise, ‘These are inner and outer phenomena,’

original: de bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / thun mong dang / thun mong ma lags pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / thun mong dang / thun mong ma lags pa dang /
translated: and likewise, ‘These are virtuous and nonvirtuous, with and without defilements, mundane and supramundane, ordinary and extraordinary,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyang bka' stsal te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyang bka' stsal te /
translated: and these are conditioned and unconditioned phenomena’?

original: rnam par dkrugs par mdzad na /
analyzed: rnam par dkrugs par mdzad na /
translated: If he disturbed the thusness of phenomena,

original: de'i slad du /
analyzed: de'i slad du /
translated: then,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs par ma gyur lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs par ma gyur lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Blessed One, has the thusness of phenomena been disturbed by the Blessed One?”

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti, that is not the case.

original: ngas ni ji ltar gzhan dag gis khong du chud par 'gyur zhes ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te /
analyzed: ngas ni ji ltar gzhan dag gis khong du chud par 'gyur zhes ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te /
translated: I teach the reality-limit of dharmas by means of names and signs, thinking, ‘How can others understand?’

original: chos rnams brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: chos rnams brjod par zad kyi /
translated: I have expressed dharmas,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs pa ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan @13b 'das; gal te gzhan dag gis khong du chud par bgyi ba'i slad du /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs pa ni ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan @13b 'das; gal te gzhan dag gis khong du chud par bgyi ba'i slad du /
translated: but I have not disturbed the reality of dharmas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Lord, if the Lord teaches the reality of dharmas by means of names and signs,

original: chos rnams brjod pa mdzad na /
analyzed: chos rnams brjod pa mdzad na /
translated: and expresses dharmas, thinking, ‘How can others understand?’

original: bcom ldan 'das ming ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i chos rnams ji ltar ming dang mtshan ma sa brjod pa mdzad lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ming ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i chos rnams ji ltar ming dang mtshan ma sa brjod pa mdzad lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Lord, how does the Lord express dharmas that are nameless and signless by means of names and signs?”

original: rab 'byor / brjod pa ni ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / brjod pa ni ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, it is not that the expression is a fixation on names and signs.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan du na sdug bsngal nyid brjod par zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan du na sdug bsngal nyid brjod par zad de /
translated: Subhūti, rather, it is just suffering that is expressed.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: They do not settle down on names and signs.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata and the Tathāgata’s śrāvakas do not settle down on names and signs.

original: rab 'byor / gal te ming la ming mngon par zhen par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te ming la ming mngon par zhen par 'gyur ram /
translated: Subhūti, if a name were to settle down on a name,

original: mtshan ma la mtshan ma mngon par zhen par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mtshan ma mngon par zhen par 'gyur na ni /
translated: or if a sign were to settle down on a sign,

original: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur la /
translated: emptiness would settle down on emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa'ang mtshan ma med pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'ang mtshan ma med pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
translated: signlessness would settle down on signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa'ang smon pa med pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'ang smon pa med pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
translated: wishlessness would settle down on wishlessness,

original: de bzhin nyid kyang de bzhin nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang de bzhin nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
translated: suchness would settle down on suchness,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
translated: the very limit of reality would settle down on the very limit of reality,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang chos kyi dbyings la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang chos kyi dbyings la mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
translated: and the dharma-constituent would settle down on the dharma-constituent.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and also the unconditioned, but the unconditioned does not stand in the unconditioned.

original: rab 'byor / 'di @14a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di @14a *//
translated: Subhūti,

original: ltar chos thams cad ni ming tsam du zad pas /
analyzed: ltar chos thams cad ni ming tsam du zad pas /
translated: it is because all dharmas are just names.

original: de dag ming tsam la gnas par mi 'gyur te /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar ming dang mtshan ma tsam lags te /
analyzed: de dag ming tsam la gnas par mi 'gyur te / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar ming dang mtshan ma tsam lags te /
translated: They do not stand in just names.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya zhing /
translated: just in names and mere signs,

original: de la'ang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la'ang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not settle down on them.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du bas pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du bas pa lags na /
translated: if all dharmas are just names and mere signs,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi ched du byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyid cing /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi ched du byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyid cing /
translated: then for whose sake do bodhisattva great beings arouse the mind of awakening?

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas kyang 'du byed sna tshogs rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing sbyin pa stsol ba dang / tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / bzod pa bsgrub pa dang /🔽brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab bsgom pa dang / stong pa nyid la bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad ma mchis pa dang / gzugs ma mchis pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas kyang 'du byed sna tshogs rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing sbyin pa stsol ba dang / tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / bzod pa bsgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab bsgom pa dang / stong pa nyid la bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad ma mchis pa dang / gzugs ma mchis pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la gnas pa dang /
translated: Engaging in the conduct of the bodhisattvas, they practice generosity, guard their ethics, cultivate patience,🔽exert themselves in diligence, enter into the absorptions, cultivate wisdom, meditate on emptiness, and abide in the concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la gnas pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la gnas pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: They abide in the applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions, and the gateways to liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.

original: de bzhin @14b gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la gnas pa dang / snying rje chen po'i bar dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: de bzhin @14b gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la gnas pa dang / snying rje chen po'i bar dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and they perfect the ten powers of the tathāgatas and so on up to great compassion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / khyod gang 'di skad du gal te chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod gang 'di skad du gal te chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du bas na /
translated: “Subhūti, you have said, ‘If all dharmas are just names and signs,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi ched du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par bgyid ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi ched du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par bgyid ces zer ba ni /
translated: then for whose sake do bodhisattva great beings practice the bodhisattva practice?’

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar 'dus byas 'di dag thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar 'dus byas 'di dag thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad la /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all these compounded things are just names and signs,

original: ming dang mtshan ma de dag kyang ming dang mtshan mas stong ste /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma de dag kyang ming dang mtshan mas stong ste /
translated: and those names and signs are empty of those names and signs.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practice the bodhisattva practice

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: and reach the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang /🔽chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang / chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed la /
translated: And having attained the knowledge of all aspects,🔽they turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas kyang /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas kyang /
translated: And having turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: sems can rnams theg pa gsum po dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed kyang /
analyzed: sems can rnams theg pa gsum po dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed kyang /
translated: they cause beings to pass into complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles.

original: ming dang mtshan ma de dag skye ba'ang med /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma de dag skye ba'ang med /
translated: But those names and signs do not arise,

original: 'jig pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'jig pa'ang med /
translated: do not disintegrate,

original: gnas pa'ang med /
analyzed: gnas pa'ang med /
translated: do not remain,

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'ang med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'ang med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: and do not change from a state of remaining, and they are not apprehended.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces gsung lags sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces gsung lags sam /
translated: do you say ‘knowledge of all aspects’ with regard to the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rnam pa thams cad @15a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rnam pa thams cad @15a *//
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mkhyen pa nyid ces nga smra'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid ces nga smra'o //
translated: “Subhūti, I say ‘knowledge of all aspects’ with regard to the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyang bka' stsal cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad shes pa nyid kyang bka' stsal cing /
translated: “Blessed One, the Tathāgata has also taught the knowledge of all things.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces mdor yang bka' stsal la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces mdor yang bka' stsal la /
translated: The Tathāgata has also said in brief, ‘the knowledge of path aspects.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang bka' stsal lags na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang bka' stsal lags na /
translated: The Tathāgata has also said, ‘the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽what is the difference between these three kinds of knowledge?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po 'di dag la bye brag ni ci mchis tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci mchis lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po 'di dag la bye brag ni ci mchis tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci mchis lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: What is the distinction between them?”

original: rab 'byor / thams cad shes pa nyid ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / thams cad shes pa nyid ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi'o //
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti, the knowledge of all is that of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rab 'byor / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi'o //
translated: Subhūti, the knowledge of path aspects is that of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
translated: Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects is that of the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly complete buddhas.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi lags /
translated: Why is the knowledge of all aspects the knowledge of the tathāgatas?

original: ci'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lags /
translated: Why is the knowledge of path aspects the knowledge of bodhisattva great beings?

original: ci'i slad du thams cad shes pa nyid ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du thams cad shes pa nyid ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lags /
translated: Why is the knowledge of all the knowledge of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / phyi nang gi chos gang dag ji snyed pa de dag @15b thams cad ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang shes la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyi nang gi chos gang dag ji snyed pa de dag @15b thams cad ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang shes la /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas know all the inner and outer dharmas there are,

original: lam thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not all the aspects of the path and not all the aspects.”

original: rab 'byor / gang yang khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang yang khyod 'di skad du /
translated: “Subhūti, you have asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lags zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lags zhes zer ba ni /
translated: ‘Lord, why is the knowledge of path aspects the knowledge of bodhisattva great beings?’

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni lam thams cad bskyed par bya zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni lam thams cad bskyed par bya zhing /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should generate all paths

original: lam thams cad shes par bya dgos te /
analyzed: lam thams cad shes par bya dgos te /
translated: and know all paths.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gang yin pa'i lam de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par bya dgos la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gang yin pa'i lam de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par bya dgos la /
translated: They should also complete those paths, which are the paths of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and the path of bodhisattvas.

original: lam de dag gis lam gyi bya ba byed kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs par ni mi byed do //
analyzed: lam de dag gis lam gyi bya ba byed kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs par ni mi byed do //
translated: Although they perform the function of the path through those paths, they should not realize the limit of reality.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par mi bgyi zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par mi bgyi zhing /
translated: how should bodhisattva-mahāsattvas not complete the Buddha path

original: des yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon sum du mi bgyi lags sam /
analyzed: des yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon sum du mi bgyi lags sam /
translated: and not realize the limit of reality?”

original: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should not purify a buddhafield

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas shing /
translated: and

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o //
translated: “Without bringing beings to maturity, one should not actualize the limit of reality.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam la gnas te /🔽yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon @16a *//
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam la gnas te / yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon @16a *//
translated: do bodhisattva great beings stand in the path🔽and actualize the limit of reality?

original: sum du bgyid lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sum du bgyid lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: ”🔽“No, Lord.

original: de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”🔽Subhūti said,🔽

original: 'o na lam ma lags pa la gnas te lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na lam ma lags pa la gnas te lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti, do they stand in what is not the path?🔽”🔽“No, Lord.

original: de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”🔽Subhūti said,🔽

original: 'o na lam dang lam ma lags pa la gnas te lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na lam dang lam ma lags pa la gnas te lags sam /
translated: “Subhūti, do they stand in the path and in what is not the path?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, “No.

original: de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na lam yang ma lags /
analyzed: de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na lam yang ma lags /
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”🔽Subhūti said, “Blessed One,🔽then is it not the path?”🔽

original: lam ma lags pa'ang ma lags pa la gnas te lags sam /
analyzed: lam ma lags pa'ang ma lags pa la gnas te lags sam /
translated: “Subhūti, do they stand neither in the path nor in what is not the path?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / de ni ma yin no //
translated: The Lord said, “No.🔽”🔽“Subhūti,🔽do they stand in the path🔽and in what is not the path?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, Bhagavan,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du bgyi lags /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du bgyi lags /
translated: “Well then, how is it that bodhisattva great beings should manifest the very limit of reality?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: khyod lam la gnas te /
analyzed: khyod lam la gnas te /
translated: Do you, standing in the path,

original: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol snyam mam /
analyzed: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol snyam mam /
translated: think that your mind is liberated from defilements without grasping?”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Blessed One, it is not.”

original: 'o na lam ma yin pa la gnas te'am /
analyzed: 'o na lam ma yin pa la gnas te'am /
translated: “Well then, do you, standing in what is not the path,

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: “It is not.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'o na lam dang / lam ma yin pa la gnas te'am /
analyzed: 'o na lam dang / lam ma yin pa la gnas te'am /
translated: “Well then, do you, standing in the path and in what is not the path,

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it is not.”

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽'o na khyod lam yang ma yin /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / 'o na khyod lam yang ma yin /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lam ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa la @16b gnas te /
analyzed: lam ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa la @16b gnas te /
translated: “Well then, do you, standing in what is not the path and in what is not not the path,

original: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lam /🔽rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lam / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: think that your mind is liberated from defilements without grasping?”🔽Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te /
translated: “No, Blessed One, it is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni gang la gnas te'ang zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol ba ma lags kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni gang la gnas te'ang zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol ba ma lags kyi /
translated: Blessed One, my mind is liberated from the defilements without having settled anywhere.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gi sems ni ji ltar gang la'ang mi gnas pas sems rnam par grol lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bdag gi sems ni ji ltar gang la'ang mi gnas pas sems rnam par grol lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: my mind is liberated because it does not settle on anything.”

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang ci la'ang mi gnas par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang ci la'ang mi gnas par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings should actualize the very limit of reality without settling on anything.

original: rab 'byor / gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa gcig gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa gcig gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, the so-called knowledge of all aspects is called the knowledge of all aspects because of one aspect,

original: 'di ltar zhi ba'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi ba'i rnam pas so //
translated: namely, peace.”🔽“Blessed One, what is the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: rab 'byor / yang rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gi chos rnams stong zhes bya bar brjod pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gi chos rnams stong zhes bya bar brjod pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pas /
translated: “Subhūti, the Tathāgata has realized all those aspects, those signs, and those marks by which phenomena are said to be empty.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the knowledge of all aspects.🔽” Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang lags pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po 'di @17a *//🔽dag las 'di'i spong ba ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //🔽'di'i spong ba ni lhag ma ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang lags pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po 'di @17a *// dag las 'di'i spong ba ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'o // 'di'i spong ba ni lhag ma ma mchis pa'o //
translated: among these three knowledges—the knowledge of all things, the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and the knowledge of all aspects—🔽is there a difference in the abandonment of defilements,

original: zhes bgyi bar nyon mongs pa spang ba la tha dad du bgyi ba mchis lags sam /
analyzed: zhes bgyi bar nyon mongs pa spang ba la tha dad du bgyi ba mchis lags sam /
translated: such that one is with remainder and the other without remainder?🔽”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / nyon mongs pa spang ba la ni tha dad pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nyon mongs pa spang ba la ni tha dad pa med mod kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, there is no difference in the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned all the connections with the latent propensities,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa ma yin no //
translated: but the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have not abandoned all the connections with the latent propensities.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob par nyon mongs pa spangs pa 'dus ma bgyis lags sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob par nyon mongs pa spangs pa 'dus ma bgyis lags sam /
translated: is the abandonment of the afflictions that is not the attainment of omniscience uncompounded?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: 'dus ma bgyis la bye brag dmigs su mchis lags sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma bgyis la bye brag dmigs su mchis lags sam /
translated: are distinctions perceived in the uncompounded?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, that is not so.

original: 'dus ma byas la ni bye brag dmigs su med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni bye brag dmigs su med do //
translated: Distinctions are not perceived in the uncompounded.”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te 'dus ma bgyis la bye brag dmigs su ma mchis na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus ma bgyis la bye brag dmigs su ma mchis na /
translated: if distinctions are not perceived in the uncompounded,

original: ci'i slad du /
analyzed: ci'i slad du /
translated: why

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du 'di ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du 'di ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: The Lord has said, “This is the abandonment of the latent afflictions.

original: 'di ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa ma yin no zhes bka' stsal lags /
analyzed: 'di ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa ma yin no zhes bka' stsal lags /
translated: This is not the abandonment of the latent afflictions.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor @17b ba ni nyon mongs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor @17b ba ni nyon mongs pa ma yin te /
translated: “Su­bhūti, the latent afflictions are not afflictions.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang bral ba'ang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang bral ba'ang yod mod kyi /
translated: Those śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are free from desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: lus kyi 'gyur ba'ang 'byung ste /
analyzed: lus kyi 'gyur ba'ang 'byung ste /
translated: However, their bodies still change.

original: de dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la'ang gnod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la'ang gnod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: They do not harm even ordinary people,

original: nyan thos rnams la'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la'ang ma yin te /
translated: let alone śrāvakas.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not have that.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: ” Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te lam yang dngos po ma mchis la /
analyzed: gal te lam yang dngos po ma mchis la /
translated: if the path is not a real thing,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang dngos po ma mchis na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang dngos po ma mchis na /
translated: If nirvana is also a non-entity,

original: ci'i slad du 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: why is it said, ‘This is a stream-enterer,

original: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: this is a once-returner,

original: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: this is a non-returner,

original: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: this is a worthy one,

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //🔽zhes bshad lags /
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so // zhes bshad lags /
translated: this is a pratyekabuddha,🔽and this is a fully awakened buddha’?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, all those who are stream-enterers and all those up to tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas are distinguished by the unconditioned.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One,

original: ci 'dus ma bgyis te /
analyzed: ci 'dus ma bgyis te /
translated: is the unconditioned distinguished

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: as ‘This is a stream-enterer,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag lags so //🔽zhes rab tu 'byed par bgyid lags sam /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar dag lags so // zhes rab tu 'byed par bgyid lags sam /
translated: this is a tathāgata, a worthy one, a perfectly complete buddha’?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“No, Subhūti.”

original: rab 'byor / 'dus ma byas ni rab tu 'byed par mi byed mod kyi 'on kyang 'jig rten @18a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dus ma byas ni rab tu 'byed par mi byed mod kyi 'on kyang 'jig rten @18a *//
translated: Subhūti, unconditioned phenomena do not make distinctions, but still,

original: gyi tha snyad tshad mar byas te brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: gyi tha snyad tshad mar byas te brjod par zad kyi /
translated: taking the conventions of the world as valid, they are expressed.

original: don dam par ni rab tu dbye bar mi nus so //
analyzed: don dam par ni rab tu dbye bar mi nus so //
translated: But ultimately, they cannot be distinguished.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de la tshig gi lam gyis gdags su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la tshig gi lam gyis gdags su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they cannot be designated by the path of words.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ji ltar gdags lags /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ji ltar gdags lags /
translated: how are the future and the past designated?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tshad mar byas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tshad mar byas te /
translated: “Subhūti, taking the conventions of the world as valid,

original: gang dang gang dag gis mtha' chad pa de dang de dag la phyi ma'i mthar gdags kyi /
analyzed: gang dang gang dag gis mtha' chad pa de dang de dag la phyi ma'i mthar gdags kyi /
translated: whatever is cut off in the future and the past is designated as the future and the past.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But not ultimately.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs lags na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs lags na /
translated: if the past is not observed in all phenomena that are empty of their own characteristics,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
translated: how much less so the future?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs na /
translated: In the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of all dharmas, the prior limit is not apprehended.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: How much less so the later limit!

original: de ni gnas med do //🔽rab 'byor / 'on kyang sems can gang dag gis chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pa de dag la 'di ni sngon gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do // rab 'byor / 'on kyang sems can gang dag gis chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pa de dag la 'di ni sngon gyi mtha'o //
translated: That is not possible.

original: 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha'o zhes bstan par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha'o zhes bstan par zad kyi /
translated: Subhūti, however, for those sentient beings who do not know that all dharmas are empty of the intrinsic nature, it is taught that this is the prior limit and that is the later limit.

original: rab 'byor / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dmigs su med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dmigs su med de /
translated: Subhūti, in dharmas that are empty of the intrinsic nature, the prior limit and the later limit are not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rang @18b gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la spyod pa ni nang ngam /🔽phyi'am / 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar rang @18b gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o // rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la spyod pa ni nang ngam / phyi'am / 'dus byas sam /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom with phenomena that are empty of their own marks.

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: Those who practice with phenomena that are empty of their own marks do not settle down on anything at all, whether internal or external, conditioned or unconditioned,

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: the dharmas of śrāvakas,🔽the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /🔽gang la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam / gang la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or the dharmas of buddhas.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: “Lord, you say ‘perfection of wisdom, perfection of wisdom.’

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi lags /
translated: Lord, why is it called the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,🔽“Subhūti, it is the perfection of wisdom because it is not wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi pha rol dam pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi pha rol dam pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is the highest perfection of all dharmas.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pas na /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, because it has reached the perfection of all dharmas.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / yang don dam par chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i don gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis @19a *//🔽mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang don dam par chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i don gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis @19a *//🔽mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Subhūti, the meaning of the inseparability of all dharmas in the ultimate is realized by the tathāgatas through this perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir de bzhin nyid kyang chud /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir de bzhin nyid kyang chud /
translated: “Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom includes suchness,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang chud /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang chud /
translated: the limit of reality,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang chud pas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang chud pas /
translated: and the dharma-constituent.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang dang yang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang dang yang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is not associated with or not disassociated from any dharma,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽bstan du yod pa'am /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin / bstan du yod pa'am /
translated: is not demonstrable,

original: bstan du med pa'am /🔽thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: bstan du med pa'am / thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: is not not demonstrable,🔽is not impeded,

original: thogs pa med pa'ang ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'ang ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and is not not impeded.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gzugs med pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gzugs med pa /
translated: If you ask why, it is because this perfection of wisdom is formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: is not demonstrable,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and is not impeded.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is the same in being without a defining mark.

original: rab 'byor yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad la spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad la spyod par byed cing /
translated: “Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is the practice of all dharmas.

original: spobs pa thams cad dang / snang ba thams cad sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: spobs pa thams cad dang / snang ba thams cad sbyin par byed pa ste /
translated: It gives all eloquence and all illumination.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bdud dam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bdud dam /
translated: “Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings cannot be cut through by Māra,

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams dang / nyan thos dang; rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag rnams kyis mi chod de /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams dang / nyan thos dang; rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag rnams kyis mi chod de /
translated: or by gods in the Māra class, or by persons in the Śrāvaka Vehicle or the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gzhan mu stegs can phyir rgol ba'i bar dag gis kyang chod par @19b mi nus so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gzhan mu stegs can phyir rgol ba'i bar dag gis kyang chod par @19b mi nus so //
translated: This perfection of wisdom cannot be cut through by others, up to the non-Buddhist ascetics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gcod par byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis gcad pa dang / bcad pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gcod par byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gis gcad pa dang / bcad pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhuti: Because the one who cuts, the one who is cut, and the one who is cut with, all these are not apprehended in this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, Subhuti, should the Bodhisattva, the great being, course in this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la 'di ltar spyad par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la 'di ltar spyad par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should course in the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.🔽And what is the meaning of the perfection of wisdom?

original: mi rtag pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal gyi don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: the meaning of suffering,

original: bdag med pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: the meaning of selflessness,

original: sdug bsngal shes pa'i don dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa'i don dang / 'gog pa shes pa'i don dang / lam shes pa'i don dang / zad pa shes pa'i don dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa'i don dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa'i don dang / 'gog pa shes pa'i don dang / lam shes pa'i don dang / zad pa shes pa'i don dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: the meaning of the knowledge of suffering, the meaning of the knowledge of the arising of suffering, the meaning of the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, the meaning of the knowledge of the path, the meaning of the knowledge of destruction, and the meaning of the knowledge of non-production.

original: chos shes pa'i don dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i don dang / kun rdzob shes pa'i don dang / yongs su 'dris pa shes pa'i don dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa'i don dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i don la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i don dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i don dang / kun rdzob shes pa'i don dang / yongs su 'dris pa shes pa'i don dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa'i don dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i don la spyad par bya ste /
translated: the meaning of the knowledge of dharmas, the meaning of subsequent knowledge, the meaning of conventional knowledge, the meaning of knowledge of full attainment, the meaning of knowledge in accordance with the letter, and the meaning of knowledge in accordance with reality.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la don dang tshul gyis spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la don dang tshul gyis spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the meaning of the perfection of wisdom in this way, by way of meaning and method.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: @20a *// gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la don dang / don ma lags pa dmigs su ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: @20a *// gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la don dang / don ma lags pa dmigs su ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: “Lord, if in this deep perfection of wisdom the sense and the non-sense are not apprehended,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la spyad par bgyi /
translated: how should a bodhisattva great being practice the sense of the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i don la spyod pas 'di ltar spyad par bya ste /🔽'dod chags bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i don la spyod pas 'di ltar spyad par bya ste / 'dod chags bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: “Subhūti, here a bodhisattva great being practicing the sense of the deep perfection of wisdom should practice like this:🔽He should not practice ‘attachment is for my benefit’

original: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o; ;zhe sdang bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o; ;zhe sdang bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: or ‘it is harmful to me.’

original: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not practice ‘aversion is for my benefit’

original: gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: or ‘it is harmful to me.’

original: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not practice ‘ignorance is for my benefit’🔽or ‘it is harmful to me.’

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Attachment, aversion, and delusion are not for one’s own sake.

original: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o //🔽log par lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o // log par lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: One should not practice desire, anger, or ignorance as being for one’s own sake or as being harmful.

original: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o //🔽lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi bar du bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o // lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi bar du bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: One should not practice wrong views as being for one’s own sake or as being harmful.

original: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa zhes bya bar spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not practice all the views as being for one’s own sake or as being harmful.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang; gti mug gi de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang don kyang mi byed la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang; gti mug gi de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang don kyang mi byed la /
translated: The suchness of desire, anger, and ignorance does not do anything for anyone or harm anyone,

original: gnod pa'ang mi byed pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang gang la'ang don kyang mi byed la /🔽gnod pa'ang @20b mi byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzugs bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'ang mi byed pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang gang la'ang don kyang mi byed la / gnod pa'ang @20b mi byed pa'i phyir ro // gzugs bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: and the suchness of the views does not do anything for anyone or harm anyone.🔽One should not practice form as being for one’s own sake or as being harmful.

original: gzugs bdag la gnod pa zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag la gnod pa zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not practice form as being for one’s own sake or as being harmful.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: up to and including consciousness, as ‘my self.’

original: rnam par shes pa bdag la gnod pa zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag la gnod pa zhes spyad par mi bya'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Consciousness should not be practiced as ‘harmful to me.’

original: byang chub kyi bar du bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Up to and including awakening, it should not be practiced as ‘my self.’🔽Awakening should not be practiced as ‘harmful to me.’

original: byang chub bdag la gnod pa zhes spyad par mi bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub bdag la gnod pa zhes spyad par mi bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gang don tam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gang don tam /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, did not apprehend any phenomenon that is beneficial or

original: gnod pa 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: gnod pa 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro // rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: harmful.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, whether the tathāgatas arise or do not arise,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings gnas pa 'di ni gang la'ang don tam /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings gnas pa 'di ni gang la'ang don tam /
translated: The reality of phenomena, the abiding nature of phenomena, the faultlessness of phenomena, and the abiding of the expanse of reality are not for the sake of anything.

original: gnod pa ci'ang mi byed de /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar don dang / gnod pa rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: gnod pa ci'ang mi byed de / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar don dang / gnod pa rnam par spangs te /
translated: the dharmatā of phenomena, the abiding of phenomena, the faultlessness of phenomena, and the abiding of the dharma-dhātu, do not benefit or harm anything at all.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that, having abandoned benefit and harm.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don kyang mi bgyid /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don kyang mi bgyid /
translated: “Lord,

original: gnod pa'ang mi bgyid pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis @21a *//
analyzed: gnod pa'ang mi bgyid pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis @21a *//
translated: why does the perfection of wisdom neither benefit nor harm?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang yang mi byed pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang yang mi byed pas /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because the perfection of wisdom does not make any conditioned or unconditioned phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang la'ang don dang gnod pa mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang la'ang don dang gnod pa mi byed do //
translated: Subhuti: For this reason, then, the perfection of wisdom does not set up any dharma or do away with any dharma.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti.🔽Subhuti: Is not the unconditioned the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas?

original: 'dus ma bgyis ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos 'phags pa thams cad kyi don ma lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dus ma bgyis ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos 'phags pa thams cad kyi don ma lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord: The unconditioned is the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.🔽But it does not set up any dharma or do away with any dharma.🔽Subhuti: Is not the unconditioned the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas?

original: rab 'byor / 'dus ma byas ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos 'phags pa rnams kyi don yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dus ma byas ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos 'phags pa rnams kyi don yin mod kyi /
translated: The Lord: The unconditioned is the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang la'ang phan ba'am /
analyzed: gang la'ang phan ba'am /
translated: But it does not set up any dharma or do away with any dharma.🔽Subhuti: Is not the unconditioned the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas?🔽The Lord: The unconditioned is the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: gnod par nye bar gnas pa'ang ma yin no //🔽rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnod par nye bar gnas pa'ang ma yin no // rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: But it does not set up any dharma or do away with any dharma.🔽Subhuti: Is not the unconditioned the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas?

original: dper na / nam mkha'i de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang phan pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha'i de bzhin nyid ni gang la'ang phan pa'am /
translated: The Lord: The unconditioned is the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: But it does not set up any dharma or do away with any dharma.🔽Subhuti: Is not the unconditioned the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas?🔽The Lord: The unconditioned is the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.🔽But it does not set up any dharma or do away with any dharma.🔽Subhuti: Is not the unconditioned the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas?🔽The Lord: The unconditioned is the aim of the Buddhas and of all the holy men, the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.🔽But it does not set up any dharma or do away with any dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gang la'ang phan pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gang la'ang phan pa'am /
translated: Subhuti:

original: gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: they do not dwell in what is harmful.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'dus ma byas kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'dus ma byas kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One, will bodhisattva great beings not attain the knowledge of all aspects if they train in the unconditioned perfection of wisdom?”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: “Blessed One,” he continued, “will they not attain the knowledge of all aspects if they train in the conditioned perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽byang chub sems @21b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'dus ma byas kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslabs nas /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / byang chub sems @21b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'dus ma byas kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslabs nas /
translated: It is so!

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who train in this deep perfection of wisdom, which is unconditioned, will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no; ;gsol pa /
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no; ;gsol pa /
translated: They will not attain it by way of duality.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then asked,

original: ci gnyis su mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su mchis pa'i chos 'thob lags sam /
analyzed: ci gnyis su mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su mchis pa'i chos 'thob lags sam /
translated: “Blessed One, will a conditioned phenomenon attain an unconditioned phenomenon?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it will not.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then asked,🔽“Blessed One, will an unconditioned phenomenon attain an unconditioned phenomenon?”

original: gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos 'thob lags sam /
analyzed: gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos 'thob lags sam /
translated: “Is the nondual attainment of a nondual dharma?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is not.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked,

original: 'o na gnyis su mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos 'thob lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na gnyis su mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos 'thob lags sam /
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, is the nondual attainment of a dual dharma?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is not.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked,

original: 'o na gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su mchis pa'i chos 'thob lags sam /
analyzed: 'o na gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos kyis gnyis su mchis pa'i chos 'thob lags sam /
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, is the dual attainment of a nondual dharma?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti, it is not.”🔽He asked,

original: 'o na ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur lags /
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, how is it attained?”

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / gang gi phyir gnyis kyi chos sam /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / gang gi phyir gnyis kyi chos sam /
translated: He replied,

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, since neither a dual dharma nor a nondual dharma is apprehended,

original: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: in that way, through the mode of nonapprehension, the knowledge of all aspects is attained.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines:

original: chos gnyis kyi zhu ba mang po'i le'u zhes bya ba ste drug cu rtsa gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: chos gnyis kyi zhu ba mang po'i le'u zhes bya ba ste drug cu rtsa gsum pa'o ////
translated: The Chapter on the Many Questions on the Two Dharmas, the thirty-third.

original: shes rab @22a *//
analyzed: shes rab @22a *//
translated: Perfection of Wisdom

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bzhi bcu drug pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu drug pa /
translated: Book 46

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having been thus instructed, the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab lags so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa de dag ni sems can yang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa de dag ni sems can yang mi dmigs la /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening do not apprehend a being,
