original: sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs par sems can rnams kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pas dka' ba bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs par sems can rnams kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pas dka' ba bgyid pa lags so //
translated: and also not apprehending sentient beings, they are engaged in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of sentient beings, and they do what is difficult.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper bgyi na /
analyzed: dper bgyi na /
translated: for example,

original: mi la la zhig gis nam mkha' rten ma mchis pa la yal ga 'gel ba bskyed par 'tshal ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi ched du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'tshal ba lags so;
analyzed: mi la la zhig gis nam mkha' rten ma mchis pa la yal ga 'gel ba bskyed par 'tshal ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi ched du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'tshal ba lags so;
translated: just as someone would want to grow a tree in the sky, which has no support, in the same way, a bodhisattva great being wants to attain the knowledge of all aspects for the sake of sentient beings.

original: ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just so!

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang sems can rnams kyi ched du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang sems can rnams kyi ched du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug cing /
translated: The bodhisattva who, for the sake of sentient beings, engages with the knowledge of all aspects

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de rtogs nas kyang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de rtogs nas kyang /
translated: and, having realized the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sems can thams cad chags pa las yongs su grol bar byed pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad chags pa las yongs su grol bar byed pa de dag ni dka' ba byed pa yin no //
translated: They are the ones who do what is difficult, those who liberate all sentient beings from attachment.

original: rab 'byor / dper @22b na; mi zhig yal ga 'gel ba bskyed par 'dod la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper @22b na; mi zhig yal ga 'gel ba bskyed par 'dod la /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this: Suppose a man wanted to grow a branch of a wish-fulfilling tree.

original: mi des yal ga 'gel ba des rtsa ba'ang mi shes /
analyzed: mi des yal ga 'gel ba des rtsa ba'ang mi shes /
translated: That man did not know the root of the wish-fulfilling tree,

original: yal ga'i mdog dang / lo ma dang / me tog kyang mi shes bzhin du /
analyzed: yal ga'i mdog dang / lo ma dang / me tog kyang mi shes bzhin du /
translated: did not know the trunk, the bark, the leaves, the flowers, or the fruit of the wish-fulfilling tree,

original: des yal ga 'gel ba de'i sdong bu bskyed de /
analyzed: des yal ga 'gel ba de'i sdong bu bskyed de /
translated: but he planted the branch of the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: bskyed nas kyang dus dus su srung zhing chus bran de /
analyzed: bskyed nas kyang dus dus su srung zhing chus bran de /
translated: Having planted it, he protected it from time to time, and watered it.

original: rim gyis sdong bu de'i yal ga'ang phun sum tshogs par gyur /🔽lo ma'ang phun sum tshogs par gyur /
analyzed: rim gyis sdong bu de'i yal ga'ang phun sum tshogs par gyur / lo ma'ang phun sum tshogs par gyur /
translated: In due course, the trunk of the wish-fulfilling tree became perfect.🔽The leaves became perfect.

original: me tog kyang phun sum tshogs par gyur /
analyzed: me tog kyang phun sum tshogs par gyur /
translated: The flowers became perfect.

original: 'bras bu'ang phun sum tshogs par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang phun sum tshogs par gyur nas /
translated: The fruit became perfect.

original: de sdong bu de'i lo ma rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: de sdong bu de'i lo ma rnams la spyod do //
translated: Then he used the leaves of the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi ched du; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs pa de'ang rim gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi ched du; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs pa de'ang rim gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod cing /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all beings, gradually practicing the six perfections,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: attains the knowledge of all aspects,

original: lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu lta bur sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu lta bur sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and becomes the sustenance of all beings, like leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa'i lo ma lta bu la brten nas sems can rnams ngan song gsum po dag las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa'i lo ma lta bu la brten nas sems can rnams ngan song gsum po dag las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, in that way, based on the bodhisattvas’ leaves, beings are completely freed from the three lower realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i me tog lta bu la brten nas sems can rnams rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i me tog lta bu la brten nas sems can rnams rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang /
translated: “Relying on the bodhisattvas, who are like flowers, beings are born in the great sāla tree-like royal families, in the great sāla tree-like brahmin families, in the great sāla tree-like business families,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba nas /🔽'du shes med /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba nas / 'du shes med /
translated: and among the Cāturmahā­rājika gods,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar @23a *//
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar @23a *//
translated: up to the Naiva­saṃjñā­nāsaṃjñāyatana gods.

original: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva great beings have attained the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sems can de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sems can de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
translated: they establish those beings in the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
translated: in the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
translated: in the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god par byed do //
translated: in the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rang byang chub la 'god par byed do //
translated: and establish them in the state of a pratyekabuddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la brten nas /
translated: And, on the basis of those bodhisattva great beings,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang /
translated: And, having attained the knowledge of all aspects,

original: lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu lta bur sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu lta bur sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be the sustenance of all beings, like leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: gang dag de la yon 'bul ba de dag thams cad kyang theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang dag de la yon 'bul ba de dag thams cad kyang theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: And all those who offer gifts to them will gradually attain complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: namely the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen pos rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: theg pa chen pos rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and the Great Vehicle,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: and they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de la sems can yang mi dmigs shing sems can du gdags pa'ang med la /
analyzed: de la sems can yang mi dmigs shing sems can du gdags pa'ang med la /
translated: And on that occasion, they will not apprehend any being, and there will be no designation of a being.

original: sems can de dag kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa las yongs su grol bar byed de /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi ched du bdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i sems can nam /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa las yongs su grol bar byed de / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi ched du bdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i sems can nam /
translated: and those sentient beings are also freed from the grasping of self.

original: @23b sems can du gdags pa ci'ang 'di na mi dmigs so //
analyzed: @23b sems can du gdags pa ci'ang 'di na mi dmigs so //
translated: Subhūti, I do not apprehend any sentient beings or designation of a sentient being at all for whose sake the bodhisattva great beings should attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid lags par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid lags par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings should be known as tathāgatas.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Why is it so, Lord?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas sems can dmyal ba thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas sems can dmyal ba thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
translated: Because, Lord, all the hells are cut off in dependence on bodhisattva great beings.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
translated: all animal rebirths will be cut off;

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
translated: all the worlds of Yama will be cut off;

original: mi khom pa thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /🔽dbul po thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi khom pa thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur / dbul po thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
translated: all the inopportune states will be cut off;🔽all poverty will be cut off;

original: dman pa'i 'gro ba thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: dman pa'i 'gro ba thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
translated: all inferior states will be cut off;

original: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /🔽gzugs kyi khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur / gzugs kyi khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur /
translated: all the desire realm will be cut off;🔽all the form realm will be cut off;

original: gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'i slad du'o //
translated: and all the formless realm will be cut off.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known as a tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @24a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @24a *//
translated: Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva, having heard this teaching,🔽

original: pa'i byang chub la ma zhugs na /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub la ma zhugs na /
translated: Subhūti, if the bodhisattva great beings had not entered into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: the past, future, and present lord buddhas would not have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: the pratyekabuddhas would not have appeared in the world,

original: dgra bcom pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: the arhats would not have appeared in the world,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i bar dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i bar dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: up to the stream enterers would not have appeared in the world,

original: sems can dmyal ba'i bar dag rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i bar dag rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /
translated: and the hells would not have been cut off,

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bar dag rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bar dag rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm would not have been cut off.”🔽“

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid lags par rig par bgyi'o //🔽zhes gang smras pa ni; rab 'byor /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid lags par rig par bgyi'o // zhes gang smras pa ni; rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so,🔽it is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that a bodhisattva great being is a tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa gdags pa'i de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis rang sangs rgyas su gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis 'phags pa thams cad du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis gzugs su gdags pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa gdags pa'i de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis rang sangs rgyas su gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis 'phags pa thams cad du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis gzugs su gdags pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, the suchness by which the Tathāgata is designated is the suchness by which a pratyekabuddha is designated, and it is the suchness by which all the noble ones are designated. It is the suchness by which form is designated, and it is the suchness by which feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are designated.

original: de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i bar du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus @24b ma byas kyi khams kyi bar du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i bar du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus @24b ma byas kyi khams kyi bar du gdags pa dang / de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: and it is on the basis of that suchness that the compounded element and the uncompounded element are designated, and it is on the basis of that suchness that the suchness of all sentient beings and

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the suchness of the tathāgatas are designated.

original: rab 'byor / ci'i phyir; de bzhin nyid de bzhin nyid ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci'i phyir; de bzhin nyid de bzhin nyid ces bya zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, why is that suchness called ‘suchness’?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin nyid 'di la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin nyid 'di la gnas nas /
translated: Because bodhisattva great beings, standing in this suchness,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘suchness.’

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na de bzhin nyid tshad mar byas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na de bzhin nyid tshad mar byas te /
translated: “Subhūti, by this one of many explanations you should know that, taking suchness as a measure,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: a bodhisattva great being is a tathāgata.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom of suchness like that.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs na /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom of suchness,

original: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po la mkhas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po la mkhas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: they become skilled in the faculties of all sentient beings,

original: dbang po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they attain skill in perfecting the faculties.

original: sems can rnams kyi las bdag gir bya ba'ang shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las bdag gir bya ba'ang shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They also know the karma of sentient beings that is to be taken up.

original: sems can rnams kyi las bdag gir bya ba shes na /🔽smon nas shes pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las bdag gir bya ba shes na / smon nas shes pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they know the karma of sentient beings that is to be taken up,🔽they complete their knowledge through aspiration.

original: smon nas shes pa yongs su rdzogs na dus gsum shes pa rnam par dag par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon nas shes pa yongs su rdzogs na dus gsum shes pa rnam par dag par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they complete their knowledge through aspiration, they purify their knowledge of the three times.

original: dus gsum shes pa rnam par sbyangs na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /🔽sems can rnams kyi don byed par @25a *//
analyzed: dus gsum shes pa rnam par sbyangs na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing / sems can rnams kyi don byed par @25a *//
translated: If the knowledge of the three times is purified, one will practice the bodhisattva deeds.🔽If one practices the bodhisattva deeds,🔽one will benefit sentient beings.

original: 'gyur ro // sems can rnams kyi don byed na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // sems can rnams kyi don byed na /
translated: If one benefits sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will purify a buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one purifies a buddhafield, one will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one attains the knowledge of all aspects, one will turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum po dag la 'god par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum po dag la 'god par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one turns the wheel of the Dharma, one will establish sentient beings in the three vehicles.

original: sems can rnams theg pa gsum po dag la bkod nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams theg pa gsum po dag la bkod nas /
translated: If one establishes sentient beings in the three vehicles,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las zla bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las zla bar 'gyur te /
translated: one will lead them to complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yon tan dang / phan yon thams cad mthong bas bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yon tan dang / phan yon thams cad mthong bas bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya zhing /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, seeing all the good qualities and benefits, should arouse the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in themselves,

original: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: and should also cause others to arouse the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag ni /
translated: those bodhisattva great beings who practice this deep perfection of wisdom as it has been taught

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi ba'i gnas lags so //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi ba'i gnas lags so //
translated: are worthy of homage from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so.

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just like that.

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byang @25b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang @25b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom as it has been taught are

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: worthy of homage from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can thams cad kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de bsod nams ji tsam zhig bskyed par 'gyur lags
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can thams cad kyi ched du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de bsod nams ji tsam zhig bskyed par 'gyur lags
translated: how much merit will a bodhisattva great being who arouses the mind of awakening for the first time and who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood for the sake of all sentient beings create?”🔽Having been asked this, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: / de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: / de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad nyan thos kyis la gnas par gyur tam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad nyan thos kyis la gnas par gyur tam /
translated: Subhuti, if all the beings in a world system of a billion worlds were to become shravakas or pratyekabuddhas,🔽

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis la gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis la gnas par gyur na /
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in a world system of a billion worlds were to become śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas,🔽and if all of them were to be honored with all forms of comfort and ease for eons equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: ci sems can de dag bsod nams mang du bskyed dam /
analyzed: ci sems can de dag bsod nams mang du bskyed dam /
translated: would those sentient beings generate a lot of merit?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, Blessed One,

original: mang lags so //
analyzed: mang lags so //
translated: it would be a lot.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One,

original: mang lags so //
analyzed: mang lags so //
translated: it would be a lot.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dpag tu ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: dpag tu ma mchis lags so //
translated: it would be immeasurable.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One,

original: tshad ma mchis lags so //🔽bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: tshad ma mchis lags so // bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: it would be limitless.🔽The Blessed One said, Subhūti, the accumulation of merit of those sentient beings in a world system of a billion worlds who are followers of the Śrāvakayāna or the Pratyekabuddhayāna,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa dang / sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams bya ba'i @26a *//
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa dang / sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams bya ba'i @26a *//
translated: and the accumulation of merit of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has given rise to the first level of the mind,

original: dngos po gang yin pa 'di gnyis la stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas bye ba phrag 'bum gyi
analyzed: dngos po gang yin pa 'di gnyis la stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas bye ba phrag 'bum gyi
translated: The merit of the bodhisattva great being who has generated the first thought of awakening is greater than the merit of the wholesome actions of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas in the thousandfold world systems of a trichiliocosm.

original: bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bar gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It is not even a hundredth part, not even a thousandth of a hundredth part, not even a hundred thousandth of a hundredth part, not even a hundred thousandth of a hundred thousandth part of that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Because the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas come from the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but the bodhisattvas do not come from the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on up to:

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: All the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas in the great billionfold world system do not approach even a hundredth part of the merit of those bodhisattva great beings who have produced the first thought of awakening.

original: rab 'byor / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams lta zhog gi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams lta zhog gi /
translated: “Subhūti, leave aside all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas in the great billionfold world system.

original: rab 'byor / gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in the great billionfold world system

original: sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
translated: were to stand on the ground of seeing what is white,

original: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni sems @26b dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni sems @26b dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: The merit of those who have entered the stages is not even a hundred-thousand-millionth part of the merit of the bodhisattva great beings who have given rise to the first level of bodhicitta.

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas pa rnams lta zhog gi /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la gnas pa rnams lta zhog gi /
translated: “Leave aside those who are on the stage of seeing white.

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag thams cad rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag thams cad rigs kyi sa la gnas par gyur kyang /
translated: If all the sentient beings included in the trichiliocosm were to be on the stage of the lineage,

original: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: the merit of those would not even be a hundred-thousand-millionth part of the merit of the bodhisattva great beings who have given rise to the first level of bodhicitta.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “In the same way, if all the sentient beings included in the trichiliocosm were to be on the stage of the eighth-lowest stage,

original: brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa can gyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du zhugs par gyur kyang /
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa can gyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du zhugs par gyur kyang /
translated: the eighth-lowest stage, the stage of insight, the stage of thinning, the stage of separation from passion, the stage of contemplation, the pratyekabuddha stage,

original: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: the merit of all of them does not approach even a hundred-thousand-millionth part of the merit of the bodhisattva great being who has first produced the thought.

original: rab 'byor / gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs par gyur kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs par gyur kyang /
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in the great billionfold world system were to enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas,

original: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni byang chub la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni byang chub la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: The merit of those who have entered enlightenment is not even a hundred thousand-billionth part of the merit of a bodhisattva who has entered enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na @27a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na @27a *//
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm

original: sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad byang chub la zhugs par gyur kyang /
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad byang chub la zhugs par gyur kyang /
translated: were to enter enlightenment,

original: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro zhing /
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyi cha'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro zhing /
translated: the merit of those who have entered enlightenment would not even be a hundred thousand-billionth part of the merit of a tathāgata, a worthy one, a perfectly awakened one.

original: rgyu dang / dpe'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang / dpe'i bar du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It would not even be a cause or an example up to that point.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ci zhig yid la bgyi lags /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ci zhig yid la bgyi lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what should a bodhisattva great being who has given rise to the first level of mind keep in mind?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who has given rise to the first level of mind should keep in mind the following: ‘I should perfect the perfection of generosity.

original: rab 'byor / sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattva, the great being, should pay attention to the knowledge of all modes when he has first started on the way.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dngos po ni ci lta bu zhig lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dngos po ni ci lta bu zhig lags /
translated: Subhuti: What is the object of the knowledge of all modes?

original: dmigs pa ni ci zhig lags /🔽dbang bgyid pa ni gang lags /🔽rnam pa ni ci zhig lags /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni ci zhig lags / dbang bgyid pa ni gang lags / rnam pa ni ci zhig lags /
translated: What is its objective range?🔽What is its mastery?🔽What is its aspect?

original: mtshan nyid ni gang lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa; mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni gang lags / bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa; mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: What is its mark?🔽The Lord: The knowledge of all modes is a non-entity, signless, and without objective range.

original: mtshan ma med pa /🔽lhun gyis grub pa /🔽skye ba med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa / lhun gyis grub pa / skye ba med pa /
translated: It is not something to be made, not something to be defiled, not something to be purified, not something that is, not something that is not.

original: 'byung ba med pa'o //🔽rab 'byor / khyod kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa'o // rab 'byor / khyod kyis 'di skad du /
translated: It is not something that is to be produced, not something that is to be stopped, not something that is to be wiped out, not something that is to be settled down in.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni ci zhig lags /🔽dbang bgyid pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni ci zhig lags / dbang bgyid pa ni gang lags /
translated: It is not something that is to be attained, not something that is to be realized, not something that is to be known, not something that is to be done.🔽It is not something that is to be gone to, not something that is to be come from, not something that is to be gone from, not something that is to be gone to.🔽It is not something that is to be gone to, not something that is to be come from, not something that is to be gone from, not something that is to be gone to.🔽It is not something that is to be gone to, not something that is to be come from, not something that is to be gone from, not something that is to be gone to.🔽It is not something that is to be gone to, not something that is to be come from, not something that is to be gone from, not something that is to be gone to.🔽It is not something that is to be gone to, not something that is to be come from, not something that is to be gone from, not something that is to be gone to.🔽It is not something that is to be gone to, not something that is to be come from, not something that is to be gone from, not something that is to be gone to.🔽It is not something that is to be gone to, not something that is to be come from, not something that is to be gone from, not something that is to be gone to.

original: rnam pa ni ci zhig lags /
analyzed: rnam pa ni ci zhig lags /
translated: It is not something that is to be

original: mtshan nyid ni gang lags zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni gang lags zhes zer ba la /
translated: “What is its defining characteristic?”

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni dngos @27b po med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni dngos @27b po med pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the object of the knowledge of all aspects is non-entity.

original: dbang byed pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: dbang byed pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: Its controlling power is mindfulness.

original: rnam pa ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Its aspect is peace.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Its defining characteristic is the absence of defining characteristics.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni de yin no //
translated: Subhūti, that is the object of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dbang byed pa ni de yin no; ;rnam pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: dbang byed pa ni de yin no; ;rnam pa ni de yin no //
translated: That is its controlling power. That is its aspect.

original: mtshan nyid ni de yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni de yin no //
translated: That is its defining characteristic.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” He said, “Lord,

original: ci rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kho na dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kho na dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: is it only the knowledge of all aspects that is a non-entity,

original: 'on te gzugs kyang dngos po ma mchis shing /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs kyang dngos po ma mchis shing /
translated: or is form also a non-entity,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: and is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness also non-entities?

original: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: And likewise, are inner and outer dharmas also non-entities?”

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
translated: the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four perfect abandonments, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties,

original: stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the meditative absorption of emptiness, the meditative absorption of signlessness, the meditative absorption of aspirationlessness, the eight aspects of liberation,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, great loving kindness,

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po @28a *//
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po @28a *//
translated: great equanimity,🔽the first superknowledge,🔽the second, third, fourth, fifth, and sixth superknowledges,

original: dang; btang snyoms chen po dang / mngon par shes pa dang po dang / mngon par shes pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: dang; btang snyoms chen po dang / mngon par shes pa dang po dang / mngon par shes pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang dngos po ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: and the compounded element and the uncompounded element are also non-entities?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dngos po med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dngos po med do //
translated: “Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects is also a non-entity.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang dngos po med do //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang dngos po med do //
translated: Form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are also non-entities.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi bar du'ang dngos po med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi bar du'ang dngos po med do //
translated: Up to the compounded element and the uncompounded element are also non-entities.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de la ni ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de la ni ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: “Subhūti, that knowledge of all aspects has no intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor / gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because that which has no intrinsic nature is a non-entity.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci'i slad du /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ci'i slad du /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa lags /
translated: why is the knowledge of all aspects without intrinsic nature?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because that which arises from a collection has no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa de dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa de dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, that which arises from a collection and has no intrinsic nature is a non-entity.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations, all phenomena are without the intrinsic nature of entities.

original: rab 'byor / yang chos thams cad ni stong pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang chos thams cad ni stong pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Subhūti, moreover, all phenomena are the intrinsic nature of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All phenomena are the intrinsic nature of signlessness and wishlessness.

original: rab 'byor / yang chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Subhūti, moreover, all phenomena are the intrinsic nature of suchness.

original: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All phenomena are the intrinsic nature of the limit of reality.

original: chos @28b thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos @28b thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All phenomena are the essence of the realm of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du de ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, through this one of many explanations you should know that all phenomena are the essence of non-entityness.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are the essence of non-entityness,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pas gang dang ldan pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pas gang dang ldan pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: how is it that bodhisattva great beings, skilled in means, with the first production of the thought, practicing the perfection of giving,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par bgyid la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par bgyid la /
translated: purify a buddhafield

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par bgyid /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par bgyid /
translated: and bring beings to maturity?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: How is it that the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are not distinct?

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dang / byams pa nas btang snyoms kyi bar dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas 'du shes med /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dang / byams pa nas btang snyoms kyi bar dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas 'du shes med /
translated: How is it that the first concentration up to the fourth concentration, love up to equanimity, the sphere of infinite space up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nang stong pa nyid nas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nang stong pa nyid nas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang /
translated: inner emptiness up to the emptiness of its own mark, the applications of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms @29a *//
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms @29a *//
translated: the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signlessness meditative stabilization, the wishlessness meditative stabilization, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions,

original: par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
translated: the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signlessness meditative stabilization, the wishlessness meditative stabilization, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, great love, and great compassion,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod cing /
translated: and they practice the knowledge of path aspects,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par bgyid la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par bgyid la /
translated: and they also purify a buddhafield

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and they bring beings to maturity.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la yongs su 'dris par byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la yongs su 'dris par byed cing /
translated: “Subhūti, they familiarize themselves with phenomena that are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la /
translated: They also purify a buddhafield,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: and they bring beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang / sems can de dag kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang / sems can de dag kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: And they know that buddhafield and those beings to be the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be known as the bodhisattva great beings’ skillful means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings, practicing the perfection of generosity,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: are familiar with the path to awakening.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Practicing the perfection of morality,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: they are familiar with the path to awakening.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Practicing the perfection of patience,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: they are familiar with the path to awakening.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Practicing the perfection of perseverance,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do // bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: they become familiar with the path to enlightenment.

original: byang chub @29b kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub @29b kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They become familiar with the path to enlightenment.🔽They become familiar with the path to enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: They become familiar with the path to enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod cing /
translated: In the same vein, they become familiar with the path to enlightenment.🔽They become familiar with the path to enlightenment.🔽They become familiar with the path to enlightenment.🔽They become familiar with the path to enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par byed la /
translated: They become familiar with the path to enlightenment.

analyzed: byang chub kyi lam de'ang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod pa de ji srid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
