original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang; byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang ldan par ma gyur pa de srid du byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par mi byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang; byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang ldan par ma gyur pa de srid du byang chub kyi lam yongs su 'dris par mi byed do //
translated: until he has attained the eighteen distinctive attributes of a Buddha, great love, great compassion, and the gnosis of the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor / 'di dag ni byang chub kyi lam yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di dag ni byang chub kyi lam yin te /
translated: Subhuti : These are the Bodhisattvas' path.

original: de byang chub kyi lam 'di dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de byang chub kyi lam 'di dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By these paths the Bodhisattvas perfect the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having perfected the perfections,

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: in one single instant they will reach the knowledge of all modes.

original: de'i tshe de'i bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad ni mi skye ba'i spong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad ni mi skye ba'i spong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time all their residues, bonds, and defilements will be abandoned by the abandonment of non-production.

original: des sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la rnam par bltas nas dngos po med par yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la rnam par bltas nas dngos po med par yang mi dmigs na /
translated: Having looked with the eye of a buddha at the world systems in the great trichiliocosm, he does not apprehend even non-entities,

original: dngos por lta ci @30a *//🔽smos; rab 'byor /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad la /
analyzed: dngos por lta ci @30a *// smos; rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad la /
translated: let alone entities.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom with regard to all dharmas whose nature is non-entity.

original: rab 'byor / dngos po'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, if even entities are not apprehended,

original: dngos po med pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa lta ci smos te /
translated: how could non-entities be apprehended?

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: That too is a bodhisattva great being’s skillful means.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom give gifts.

original: de sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
analyzed: de sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
translated: When they give gifts,

original: rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: they do not conceptualize and do not make signs.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du yid la mi byed do //
translated: He does not pay attention to it as a thing or a non-thing.

original: len pa por yang rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: len pa por yang rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: He does not form mental constructs about the receiver and does not make mental constructs about it as a sign.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du yid la mi byed do //
translated: He does not pay attention to it as a thing or a non-thing.

original: sbyin pa por yang rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pa por yang rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: He does not form mental constructs about the giver and does not make mental constructs about it as a sign.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du yid la mi byed do //
translated: He does not pay attention to it as a thing or a non-thing.

original: byang chub kyi sems de'ang mi dmigs shing mtshan mar mi byed la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de'ang mi dmigs shing mtshan mar mi byed la /
translated: He does not apprehend that thought of awakening, does not make mental constructs about it as a sign,

original: dmigs par mi byed de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi byed do //
analyzed: dmigs par mi byed de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi byed do //
translated: does not apprehend it, and does not see it as real.🔽Up to the perfection of wisdom, he does not form mental constructs about it as a thing or a non-thing and does not make mental constructs about it as a sign.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du yid la mi byed cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul du yid la mi byed cing /
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects, he does not pay attention to it as a thing or a non-thing,

original: rnam par mi rtog la yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog la yid la mi byed do //
translated: He does not conceptualize the nonconceptual.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi @30b bar du'ang dmigs par mi byed cing mtshan mar mi byed do //🔽gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /🔽gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi @30b bar du'ang dmigs par mi byed cing mtshan mar mi byed do // gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am / gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'am /
translated: He does not objectify or conceptualize unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽He does not conceptualize the one who awakens,🔽the awakening,

original: gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de'ang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de'ang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rtog par mi byed do //
translated: or the awakening itself, in terms of real or unreal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Because all phenomena are essentially unreal.

original: dngos po med pa de'ang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma byas shing /
analyzed: dngos po med pa de'ang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma byas shing /
translated: That unreality is not created by the buddhas, śrāvakas, or pratyekabuddhas.

original: chos thams cad ni 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are unchanging

original: byed pa po dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are devoid of an agent.🔽Śāriputra then asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags sam /
translated: Are phenomena separated from phenomena?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: chos rnams ni chos rnams dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams ni chos rnams dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Phenomena are separated from phenomena.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti then asked,

original: gal te chos rnams kho na chos rnams dang bral ba lags na /🔽bral ba'i chos kyis bral ba'i chos dngos po mchis pa'am /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams kho na chos rnams dang bral ba lags na / bral ba'i chos kyis bral ba'i chos dngos po mchis pa'am /
translated: “Blessed One, if phenomena are separated from phenomena,

original: dngos po ma mchis par ji ltar 'tshal bar rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis par ji ltar 'tshal bar rung ste /
translated: how can a phenomenon that is separated from another phenomenon be known as existent or nonexistent?

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang /
translated: A phenomenon that is nonexistent

original: dngos po mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung la /
analyzed: dngos po mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung la /
translated: cannot know a phenomenon that is existent,

original: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang /
analyzed: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang /
translated: and a phenomenon that is existent

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung /
translated: cannot know a phenomenon that is nonexistent.

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang /
translated: A phenomenon that is nonexistent

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung la /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung la /
translated: cannot know a phenomenon that is nonexistent,

original: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang /
analyzed: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang /
translated: and a phenomenon that is existent🔽cannot know a phenomenon that is existent.

original: dngos po mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung lags na /
analyzed: dngos po mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung lags na /
translated: It is not right to ask for things.🔽 🔽I have no need for anything, said the king.

original: de ltar ma 'tshal ba'i @31a *//🔽chos thams cad la dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar ma 'tshal ba'i @31a *// chos thams cad la dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: “If it is not suitable to teach the Dharma that has a basis,🔽then how could bodhisattva great beings teach🔽all dharmas that are not taught

original: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ston par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ston par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: as ‘having a basis’ or ‘not having a basis’?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob bzung ste /🔽dngos po yod pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob bzung ste / dngos po yod pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings, taking up the conventional of the world,

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ston gyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ston gyi /
translated: teach ‘existing things’ or ‘non-existing things,’

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: ci 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig lags la /
analyzed: ci 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig lags la /
translated: is the conventional of the world one thing

original: don dam pa'ang gzhan zhig lags sam /
analyzed: don dam pa'ang gzhan zhig lags sam /
translated: and the ultimate another?”

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: He said, “Subhūti,

original: don dam pa'ang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'ang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: the conventional of the world is not one thing and the ultimate another.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin la /
translated: The suchness of the conventional of the world is just the suchness of the ultimate.

original: de bzhin nyid de sems can de dag gis mi shes shing ma mthong bas /🔽de dag gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de sems can de dag gis mi shes shing ma mthong bas / de dag gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: That suchness is not known and not seen by those sentient beings.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: Therefore, for their sake, the bodhisattva teaches the existence or nonexistence of things by means of the conventional of the world.

original: rab 'byor / yang sems can 'di dag ni phung po lnga po 'di dag la dngos por 'du shes shing dngos po med par mi shes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang sems can 'di dag ni phung po lnga po 'di dag la dngos por 'du shes shing dngos po med par mi shes te /
translated: “Subhūti, moreover, these sentient beings have the notion of things with regard to these five aggregates, and do not know them to be nonexistent.

original: ji ltar byas na dngos po med pa rtogs par 'gyur zhig gu snyam nas /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na dngos po med pa rtogs par 'gyur zhig gu snyam nas /
translated: How can they come to know nonexistence?

original: de dag gi don du chos rnams rab tu dbye ba'i phyir de ltar ston par byed de /
analyzed: de dag gi don du chos rnams rab tu dbye ba'i phyir de ltar ston par byed de /
translated: For their sake, in order to distinguish phenomena, he teaches in that way.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: shes rab @31b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab @31b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: yang dag par bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'o ////🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'o //// de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: this was chapter sixty-four, “The Teaching.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: ‘bodhisattva practice, bodhisattva practice’—

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: what is the referent of the term ‘bodhisattva practice’?🔽”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba de ni byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba de ni byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti,” he replied, “‘bodhisattva practice’ is practicing for awakening,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and so it is called ‘bodhisattva practice.’🔽”

original: gsol ba; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol ba; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi spyod pa de gang la spyod lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi spyod pa de gang la spyod lags /
translated: What is the bodhisattva great beings’ bodhisattva conduct?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gzugs stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / nang dang phyi'i chos rnams stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / nang dang phyi'i chos rnams stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang /
translated: “They practice ‘form is empty,’ ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty,’ and similarly, ‘the constituents, the sense fields, and inner and outer phenomena are empty.’

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: They practice ‘the perfection of giving is empty,’ ‘the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are empty.’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid @32a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid @32a *//
translated: They practice by saying, ‘Inner and outer emptiness is empty.’🔽In the same way, connect this with each, up to

original: stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: they practice by saying, ‘The emptiness of its own mark is empty.’🔽They practice by saying, ‘The first concentration, second concentration, third concentration, and fourth concentration are empty.’

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang /
translated: They practice by saying, ‘Love, compassion, joy, and equanimity are empty.’

original: btang snyoms stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: btang snyoms stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med /
translated: They practice by saying, ‘The station of endless space, station of endless consciousness, station of nothing-at-all, and station of neither perception nor nonperception are empty.’

original: 'du shes med min skye mched stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang /
translated: They engage in the notion that the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is empty. They engage in the notion that the four applications of mindfulness are empty. They engage in the notion that the four correct exertions are empty. They engage in the notion that the four bases of supernatural powers are empty.

original: dbang po lnga stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / stobs lnga stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dbang po lnga stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / stobs lnga stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: They engage in the notion that the five faculties are empty. They engage in the notion that the five powers are empty. They engage in the notion that the seven aspects of enlightenment are empty. They engage in the notion that the noble eightfold path is empty. They engage in the notion that the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: the absence of attributes,🔽the absence of aspiration,🔽the meditative stabilities,🔽the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽

original: yi ge rnams la 'jug pa stong ngo @32b zhes spyod pa dang / yi ge rnams med pa la 'jug pa stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / gzugs stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / 'dus byas kyi khams stong ngo zhes spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams stong ngo zhes spyod pa ste /

translated: “The letters are engaged in emptiness” is a practice. “The letters are non-existent and engaged in emptiness” is a practice. “Form is empty” is a practice. “The compounded element is empty” is a practice. “The uncompounded element is empty” is a practice.

original: ci nas byang chub la gnyis su mi 'byed pa de ltar rjes su spyod do //
analyzed: ci nas byang chub la gnyis su mi 'byed pa de ltar rjes su spyod do //
translated: They practice in such a way that they do not differentiate enlightenment as two.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa yin no //
translated: they practice for enlightenment.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: sangs rgyas sangs rgyas zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sangs rgyas zhes bgyi na /
translated: when you say ‘buddha, buddha,’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
translated: What is the meaning of the word ‘Buddha’?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / yang dag pa'i don ni sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang dag pa'i don ni sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the meaning of ‘Buddha’ is the meaning of ‘perfect.’

original: rab 'byor / yang des yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang des yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, because he has perfectly awakened to the perfect Dharma, he is called a ‘Buddha.’

original: rab 'byor / yang des yang dag pa'i don rtogs pas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang des yang dag pa'i don rtogs pas na /
translated: Subhūti, because he has realized the perfect meaning,

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called a ‘Buddha.’

original: rab 'byor / yang chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, because he has perfectly awakened to all phenomena just as they are, he is called a ‘Buddha.’🔽” Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub byang chub ces bgyi na /
analyzed: byang chub byang chub ces bgyi na /
translated: you say ‘awakening,’

original: byang chub ces bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
analyzed: byang chub ces bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
translated: what is the meaning of the word ‘awakening’?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: Subhūti, “awakening” is a term for emptiness.

original: de ni de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dvags @33a *//🔽so; ;de ni yang dag pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dvags @33a *// so; ;de ni yang dag pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: It is a term for suchness.🔽It is a term for reality.

original: de ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: It is a term for the limit of reality.

original: de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: It is a term for the dharma-constituent.

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub ces bya ba de ni ming tsam gyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub ces bya ba de ni ming tsam gyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: Subhūti, “awakening” is also a term for mere names.

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub kyi don ni yang dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub kyi don ni yang dag pa'i don to //
translated: Subhūti, the meaning of awakening is the true meaning.

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub ni de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub ni de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Subhūti, awakening is suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness, and the nature of non-delusion.

original: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called “awakening.”

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub de ni chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du rtogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub de ni chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du rtogs par byed pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, awakening is the realization that all phenomena are mere names and mere signs.

original: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste /
translated: Subhūti, that is the enlightenment of the lord buddhas,

original: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: therefore it is called enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, moreover, that enlightenment is fully awakened to by the lord buddhas, therefore it is called enlightenment.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti asked him, “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa lags na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa lags na /
translated: when a bodhisattva great being practices this enlightenment, he practices the six perfections, up to practices the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang bsags pa'am /
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang bsags pa'am /
translated: What are the wholesome roots he has accumulated,

original: 'grib pa'am / nyams pa'am /
analyzed: 'grib pa'am / nyams pa'am /
translated: or diminished, or lost,

original: 'phel ba'am / skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'phel ba'am / skye ba'am /
translated: or increased, or produced,🔽or

original: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: nor does it cease, nor is it defiled,

original: rnam par byang bar @33b 'gyur ba lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar @33b 'gyur ba lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: nor is it purified.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa de ni chos gang yang bsags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa de ni chos gang yang bsags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti then asked him, “Lord, when bodhisattva great beings practicing this perfection of wisdom practice the six perfections, up to practice the knowledge of all aspects, do they practice for the sake of increasing or decreasing any dharma,

original: 'grib par bya ba'i phyir ram /🔽nyams par bya ba'i phyir ram /🔽'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'grib par bya ba'i phyir ram / nyams par bya ba'i phyir ram / 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: for the sake of diminishing or increasing,

original: bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ram /🔽dgag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ram / dgag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: for the sake of producing or stopping,🔽for the sake of taking on or rejecting,🔽for the sake of defiling or purifying,

original: kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: or for the sake of accumulating or dispersing?🔽Why is it so?”🔽“Subhūti, it is so,” said the Lord, “because bodhisattva great beings practicing this perfection of wisdom do not practice for the sake of increasing or decreasing any dharma,

original: rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir mi spyod do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir mi spyod do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na; rab 'byor /
translated: up to do not practice for the sake of accumulating or dispersing any dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub ni bsags pa'i phyir ram /🔽'grib par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub ni bsags pa'i phyir ram / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The enlightenment of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom is not present in the manner of an object of observation in order to accumulate,🔽in order to diminish,

original: nyams par bya ba'i phyir ram /🔽'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nyams par bya ba'i phyir ram / 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: in order to deteriorate,🔽in order to increase,

original: bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ram /🔽dgag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ram / dgag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: in order to generate,🔽in order to stop,🔽in order to be afflicted,

original: kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'i phyir ram /🔽rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'i phyir ram / rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or in order to be purified.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub ni chos gang la'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub ni chos gang la'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma lags na /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽if the enlightenment of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom is not present in the manner of an object of observation for any phenomenon,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de /
translated: then how will bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin @34a *//
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin @34a *//
translated: How do they embrace the perfection of generosity,

original: pa dang / de bzhin du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: pa dang / de bzhin du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: and similarly, how do they embrace up to the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa lags /
translated: How do they practice inner emptiness, and how do they practice up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa lags /🔽dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa lags / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa nas /
translated: How do they practice the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la spyod pa lags /
translated: How do they practice the applications of mindfulness, and how do they practice up to the noble eightfold path?

original: rnam par thar ba'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i bar la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po'i bar la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: rnam par thar ba'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i bar la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po'i bar la spyod pa lags /
translated: How do they practice the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation, and how do they practice up to the ten powers of the tathāgatas and great compassion?

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po dag la spyod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las shin tu 'da' ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po dag la spyod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las shin tu 'da' ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa lags /
translated: surpass the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels, and enter into the bodhisattvas’ faultless state?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
translated: “Su­bhūti, when great bodhisattva beings practice the conduct of a bodhisattva,

original: gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: they do not practice the transcendent perfection of generosity by means of a dualistic approach.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽gnyis kyi tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / gnyis kyi tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la mi spyod do //
translated: In the same vein,🔽they do not practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom by means of a dualistic approach.

original: gnyis kyi tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the knowledge of all aspects by means of a dualistic approach.

original: rab 'byor / de @34b ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de @34b ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: take hold of the perfection of generosity and take hold of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: gal te gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod la /
analyzed: gal te gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod la /
translated: if they do not practice the perfection of generosity in a dualistic way,

original: de bzhin du gnyis kyi tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod lags na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis kyi tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mi spyod lags na /
translated: and similarly, if they do not practice the knowledge of all aspects in a dualistic way,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings, starting from the production of the first thought,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: increase their wholesome roots

original: sems bskyed pa tha ma'i bar du ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi sa rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa tha ma'i bar du ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi sa rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur lags /
translated: How do the roots of virtue increase from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up until the tenth stage?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord replied to Subhūti, the elder:

original: rab 'byor / gang dag gnyis la spyod pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang dag gnyis la spyod pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Subhūti, those who practice dualistically do not increase in the roots of virtue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / gnyis la brten pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gnyis la brten pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad de /
translated: Subhūti, all foolish common people are based on duality.

original: de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not increase in the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gnyis su mi spyod pas sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /🔽dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gnyis su mi spyod pas sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste / dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The bodhisattva does not practice dualistically. From the first production of the thought of enlightenment he increases in the wholesome dharmas.

original: sems bskyed pa tha ma'i bar du dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel @35a *//
analyzed: sems bskyed pa tha ma'i bar du dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel @35a *//
translated: Up until the last production of the thought of enlightenment he increases in the wholesome dharmas.

original: bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar 'gyur te /
translated: and in the middle.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pas 'jig rten gyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pas 'jig rten gyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus so //
translated: Those wholesome roots cannot be overcome by the world with its gods, humans, and antigods.

original: mi dge ba gang dag gis zil gyis non par gyur pa ni /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba gang dag gis zil gyis non par gyur pa ni / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Those wholesome roots that have been overcome🔽will lead to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan dag gis kyang 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan dag gis kyang 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And other wholesome roots will be stolen away.

original: de dag gis 'phrogs pas sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: de dag gis 'phrogs pas sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba nas /
translated: When they have been stolen away, when they are practicing the perfection of giving,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: their wholesome roots will not increase, up to when they are practicing the knowledge of all aspects, their wholesome roots will not increase.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi slad du /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi slad du /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One,🔽do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: for the sake of wholesome roots?🔽”

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “No, Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin la /
translated: bodhisattva great beings do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of wholesome roots,

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phyir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phyir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: nor do they practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of unwholesome roots.

original: 'on kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'on kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas sam /
translated: However, they do not serve the blessed buddhas

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par ma byas sam /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par ma byas sam /
translated: without completing their wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i @35b bshes gnyen dag gis yongs su ma zin par yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: dge ba'i @35b bshes gnyen dag gis yongs su ma zin par yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus so //
translated: Without being assisted by spiritual friends, bodhisattva great beings are unable to attain the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pas ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pas ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings who have served the blessed buddhas, who have completed their roots of virtue, and who have been assisted by spiritual friends attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Subhūti, here, from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang /
translated: They serve the tathāgatas, the arhats, the completely perfect buddhas, and those blessed buddhas teach them the sūtra section, the melodious section, the prophetic section, the verse section,

original: ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang /
translated: the section of the sayings, the section of the past events, the section of the causes, the section of the extensive, the section of the marvelous events,

original: gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde bstan pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde bstan pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: and the section of the established teachings. They retain all those teachings.

original: bzung nas kyang tshig gis yongs su 'dris par byas nas /
analyzed: bzung nas kyang tshig gis yongs su 'dris par byas nas /
translated: Having retained them, they become familiar with them through their words.

original: yid kyi rjes su rtog par byed la /
analyzed: yid kyi rjes su rtog par byed la /
translated: They contemplate them with their minds.

original: lta bas shin tu rtogs par byed cing gzungs thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta bas shin tu rtogs par byed cing gzungs thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through view, they will attain dhāraṇī.

original: @36a *// gzungs thob nas kyang so so yang dag par rig pa bskyed do //
analyzed: @36a *// gzungs thob nas kyang so so yang dag par rig pa bskyed do //
translated: Having attained dhāraṇī, they will give rise to the discrimination of eloquence.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bskyed nas de tshe brdas nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob kyi bar du nam yang chos de dag chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bskyed nas de tshe brdas nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob kyi bar du nam yang chos de dag chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having given rise to the discrimination of eloquence, they will never lose those dharmas until they have attained the knowledge of all aspects.

original: der de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed par byed de /
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed par byed de /
translated: They will plant wholesome roots with those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su zin pas gzhan yang ngan song rnams dang / mi khom pa rnams su mi skye zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang bsam pa gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su zin pas gzhan yang ngan song rnams dang / mi khom pa rnams su mi skye zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang bsam pa gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang /
translated: Seized by those wholesome roots, they will not be reborn in the lower realms or in the unfortunate states. With those wholesome roots, they will purify a buddhafield and mature beings with the intention for which they have purified the buddhafield.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will also acquire the pure intention to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bzung bas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos gang dag sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i bsngags ba brjod pa rnams dang nam du'ang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bzung bas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos gang dag sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i bsngags ba brjod pa rnams dang nam du'ang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And by acquiring those wholesome roots, they will never be separated from the spiritual friends, the lord buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings, and the śrāvakas who praise the buddha vehicle.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su bzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su bzung bar bya ste /
translated: should thus serve the lord buddhas and acquire wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la'ang bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la'ang bsten par bya'o //
translated: They should also rely on spiritual friends.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa @36b las; dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen pa dang bsten pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i thabs kyi le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa @36b las; dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen pa dang bsten pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i thabs kyi le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa lnga pa'o ////
translated: This was the sixty-fifth chapter, “The Method of Attending, Relying upon, and Honoring Spiritual Friends,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur mi bgyid cing dge ba'i rtsa ba dag kyang mi bskyed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur mi bgyid cing dge ba'i rtsa ba dag kyang mi bskyed la /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings do not serve the blessed buddhas, do not plant wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kyang yongs su ma zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kyang yongs su ma zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: and are not taken hold of by spiritual friends, will those bodhisattva great beings not attain omniscience?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Su­bhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas la /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have not served the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma bskyed cing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma bskyed cing /
translated: who have not produced wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag gis yongs su ma zin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag gis yongs su ma zin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and who have not been taken hold of by spiritual friends will not attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la'ang bsnyen bkur byas shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la'ang bsnyen bkur byas shing /
translated: Even if they have served the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang bskyed la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang bskyed la /
translated: produced wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang bsten du zin kyang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang bsten du zin kyang /
translated: and attended on spiritual friends,

original: da dung rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus na /
analyzed: da dung rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus na /
translated: they still cannot attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas shing /
translated: If that is so, how much less will those who have not served the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par ma byas la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su rdzogs par ma byas la /
translated: who have not completed the wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag la ma bsten par rnam pa thams cad @37a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag la ma bsten par rnam pa thams cad @37a *//
translated: and who have not attended on spiritual friends be able to attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: mkhyen pa nyid thob pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid thob pa lta ci smos te /
translated: how much more so for the attainment of omniscience.

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is not possible.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should serve the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed par bya /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed par bya /
translated: they should produce the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten par bya'o //
translated: and they should rely on spiritual friends.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis shing /
analyzed: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis shing /
translated: why is it that even though bodhisattva great beings serve the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang bskyed la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang bskyed la /
translated: produce the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur lags /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur lags /
translated: and rely on spiritual friends, they do not attain omniscience?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: “Because they lack skill in means.

original: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las thabs de ma thos la /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las thabs de ma thos la /
translated: They do not hear that skillful means from those lord buddhas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang ma bskyed de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang ma bskyed de /
translated: and they have not produced those wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang dag de la thabs ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la'ang ma bsten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang dag de la thabs ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la'ang ma bsten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they have not attended on those spiritual friends who would teach them the skillful means.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs la mkhas pa gang lags /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs la mkhas pa gang lags /
translated: what is the skillful means that a bodhisattva great being should have in order to attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Subhūti, here a bodhisattva great being,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: from the time of their first production of the thought of awakening,

original: sbyin @37b pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: sbyin @37b pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: when practicing the perfection of generosity,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / mir gyur ba rnams dang / mi ma yin par gyur pa rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / mir gyur ba rnams dang / mi ma yin par gyur pa rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: With attention connected with the knowledge of all modes he gives gifts to the Buddhas, the Lords, to the Pratyekabuddhas, to the Sravakas, to men and to non-men.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag dang ldan pas de sbyin pa la'ang sbyin pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag dang ldan pas de sbyin pa la'ang sbyin pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
translated: Endowed with attention connected with the knowledge of all modes, he does not even have the notion of 'giving' in regard to giving,

original: len pa po la'ang len pa po'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: len pa po la'ang len pa po'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
translated: nor the notion of 'recipient' in regard to the recipient,

original: sbyin pa po la'ang sbyin pa po'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa po la'ang sbyin pa po'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor the notion of 'giver' in regard to the giver.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa dang / yongs su ma grub pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa dang / yongs su ma grub pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong la /
translated: Because he sees that all dharmas are empty of own-marks, not fully being, not come forth,

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la'ang 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la'ang 'jug ste /
translated: and he penetrates the dharma-mark of dharmas.

original: chos thams cad byed pa'i mthu med cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa'i mthu med cing /
translated: because all phenomena are powerless and

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: characterized by non-performance.

original: thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with that skillful means, they increase their wholesome roots.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel na /
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel na /
translated: When they increase their wholesome roots,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: they practice the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: When they practice the perfection of generosity,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: they bring sentient beings to maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la; 'khor ba na sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su longs spyod pa gang yin pa'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la'ang mi re ste /🔽gzhan du na sems can yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su dgrol ba'i @38a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la; 'khor ba na sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su longs spyod pa gang yin pa'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la'ang mi re ste / gzhan du na sems can yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su dgrol ba'i @38a *//
translated: and purify a buddha-field, but they do not hope for the result of generosity, which is to enjoy the fruits of generosity in saṃsāra.🔽Rather, they practice the perfection of generosity

original: phyir / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: phyir / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: in order to protect sentient beings and liberate sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa drug pa'o ////
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa drug pa'o ////
translated: The Chapter on the Teaching of Skill in Means, the Sixty-Sixth

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of morality,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening🔽until they sit on the seat of awakening, they guard that morality with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis tshul khrims de srung ste de 'dod chags kyi sems dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / byang chub la bgegs byed pa'i mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos gang yang rung ba /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis tshul khrims de srung ste de 'dod chags kyi sems dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / byang chub la bgegs byed pa'i mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos gang yang rung ba /
translated: They do not allow any unwholesome roots of virtue that would obstruct awakening to arise,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as a mind of desire,🔽a mind of anger,🔽a mind of ignorance,🔽latent tendencies,🔽or reactive emotions.

original: ser sna dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'khrug pa'i sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / dman pa'i sems dang; 'khrul pa'i sems dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi sems dang / nga rgyal dang / brnyas pa dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal lam /🔽nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lam /
analyzed: ser sna dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'khrug pa'i sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / dman pa'i sems dang; 'khrul pa'i sems dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi sems dang / nga rgyal dang / brnyas pa dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal lam / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lam /
translated: They will not be obscured by stinginess, immorality, an agitated mind, a lazy mind, a lowly mind, a confused mind, a mind of faulty wisdom, pride, contempt, or the pride of thinking “I am” or the pride of thinking “I am superior.”

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems kyis bsgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems kyis bsgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be obscured by the thought of the śrāvakas or the thought of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
translated: It is because they know that all phenomena are empty of their own marks.

original: chos thams cad ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma grub pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma grub pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong la /
translated: They see that all phenomena are unarisen, unestablished, and unmanifest.

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug ste /
translated: They engage with the mark of the nature of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad byed pa'i mthu med cing mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan @38b nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa'i mthu med cing mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan @38b nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because they engage with the mark of the nature of phenomena, which is that all phenomena are powerless and unconditioned.

original: thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has that skillful means increases the wholesome roots.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rnam par 'phel na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: When he increases the wholesome roots, he practices the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: When he practices the perfection of morality,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: he brings beings to maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la /
translated: and also purifies the buddhafield.

original: 'khor ba na tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu yongs su longs spyad pa gang yin pa'i tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu la'ang mi re ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba na tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu yongs su longs spyad pa gang yin pa'i tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu la'ang mi re ste /
translated: He does not hope for the result of morality in saṃsāra, that result of morality.

original: gzhan du na sems can rjes su bzung ba dang sems can la mi gnod pa dang / sems can la phan par 'dod pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can rjes su bzung ba dang sems can la mi gnod pa dang / sems can la phan par 'dod pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Rather, he practices the perfection of morality for the sake of taking care of beings, for the sake of not harming beings, and for the sake of desiring to benefit beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines it is said:

original: tshul khrims kyi le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa bdun pa'o ////
translated: This was the sixty-seventh chapter, “Moral Discipline,” of the virtuous acts of the bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, and the perfection of concentration.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis shes rab sgom par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis shes rab sgom par byed de /
translated: they cultivate wisdom with attention connected with omniscience.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi sems nas /🔽nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi sems kyis bsgrib par @39a *//
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi sems nas / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi sems kyis bsgrib par @39a *//
translated: In this, they are not obscured by a mind of desire,

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or by a mind from the level of the śrāvakas up to the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing chos thams cad ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma grub pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing chos thams cad ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma grub pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong la /
translated: Subhūti, it is because they know that all phenomena are empty of their own marks, and they see that all phenomena are non-arisen,🔽unreal, and unactualized.

original: chos thams cad kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug ste /🔽chos thams cad byed pa'i mthu med cing /
