analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug ste / chos thams cad byed pa'i mthu med cing /
translated: They engage with the mark of the nature of all phenomena.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: They engage with the mark of the absence of power and the absence of conditioning of all phenomena.

original: thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with that skillful means, they increase their roots of virtue.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi rnam par 'phel na /
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi rnam par 'phel na /
translated: When they increase their roots of virtue,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: they bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la 'khor ba na shes rab kyi 'bras bu yongs su longs spyad pa gang yin pa'i shes rab kyi 'bras bu la'ang mi re ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la 'khor ba na shes rab kyi 'bras bu yongs su longs spyad pa gang yin pa'i shes rab kyi 'bras bu la'ang mi re ste /
translated: They also purify a buddhafield, and they do not expect a reward for the results of their wisdom in saṃsāra.

original: gzhan du na sems can yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su dgrol pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs su dgrol pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom in order to save beings and to liberate beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines:

original: rnam par 'phel ba'i le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba'i le'u zhes bya ste drug cu rtsa brgyad pa'o ////
translated: The Chapter on the Increase of Wisdom, the Eighty-Sixth

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa nas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having entered into the first concentration,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du snyoms par 'jug /🔽tshad med @39b pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du snyoms par 'jug / tshad med @39b pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug /
translated: enter into the fourth concentration.🔽They enter into the immeasurables.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: They enter into the formless absorptions.

original: rnam par smin pa'ang yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'ang yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: and also does not grasp the maturation of those wholesome roots.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de ni thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan na /🔽bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan na / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes pa nas /
translated: Because he is endowed with skill in means,🔽and is endowed with skill in means in that he knows the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions to be empty of their own marks,

original: mngon par ma grub pa'i bar du shes pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa'i bar du shes pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to and he knows them not to be produced.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas mthong ba dang bsgom pas spong ba'i lam la spyod kyang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas mthong ba dang bsgom pas spong ba'i lam la spyod kyang /
translated: with skill in means practice the path of seeing and the path of meditation,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang thob par mi byed do //
translated: but do not attain the result of stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyang thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyang thob par mi byed do //
translated: and he does not even attain the fruit of stream-winner, the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, or the fruit of the state of a worthy one.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes la /
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes la /
translated: Because he knows that all dharmas are empty of their own marks,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag la'ang spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag la'ang spyod cing /
translated: and he practices those dharmas that are the wings of enlightenment,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las kyang 'da' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las kyang 'da' ba'i phyir te /
translated: and he goes beyond the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos rnams la bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos rnams la bzod pa yin no //
translated: That, Subhūti, is the bodhisattva great beings’ patience with regard to dharmas that do not arise.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la snyoms par 'jug cing /🔽mthar gyis @40a *//
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la snyoms par 'jug cing / mthar gyis @40a *//
translated: enter into the eight deliverances

original: gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la'ang snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la'ang snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: and enter into the nine serial absorptions.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang thob par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang thob par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: they will not attain the fruit of entering the stream,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du'ang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du'ang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: up to they will not attain arhatship.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes pa nas chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa'i bar du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes pa nas chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa'i bar du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because they know that all phenomena are empty of their own marks, up to they know that all phenomena are unproduced.

original: rab 'byor; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / snying rje chen po la'ang 'dres par byed la /
analyzed: rab 'byor; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / snying rje chen po la'ang 'dres par byed la /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings mix with the ten tathāgata powers, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par ma byas shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par ma byas shing /
translated: but they do not purify a buddhafield

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas kyi bar du'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma byas kyi bar du'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi byed de /
translated: and until they have brought beings to maturity, they do not attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o ////
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o ////
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that.”🔽The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa /
translated: The Fourth Fascicle

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Thus did he speak, and the venerable Subhūti said this to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar chos zab mo rnams la spyod cing rnam par smin pa'ang len par mi bgyid pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar chos zab mo rnams la spyod cing rnam par smin pa'ang len par mi bgyid pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who practice like that with profound dharmas and do not take up their results

original: blo'i mchog @40b dang ldan pa lags so //
analyzed: blo'i mchog @40b dang ldan pa lags so //
translated: have the highest intelligence.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Su­bhūti, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: That is exactly how it is!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar chos zab mo rnams la spyod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar chos zab mo rnams la spyod cing /
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who practice the profound transcendent perfection of wisdom in that manner

original: rnam par smin pa'ang len par mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'ang len par mi byed pa ni /
translated: and who do not appropriate the fruits of their practice

original: blo'i mchog dang ldan pa yin no //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: blo'i mchog dang ldan pa yin no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: are endowed with the highest intellect.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you ask why, Su­bhūti, it is because great bodhisattva beings do not waver from their essential nature.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” “Blessed One,

original: ngo bo nyid gang las mi g-yo ba lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang las mi g-yo ba lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: from which essential nature do they not waver?

original: dngos po med pa las mi g-yo ba'o //🔽rab 'byor; khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: dngos po med pa las mi g-yo ba'o // rab 'byor; khyod 'di skad du /
translated: ” “Su­bhūti, they do not waver from the essential nature of non-entity.

original: ngo bo nyid gang las mi g-yo ba lags zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang las mi g-yo ba lags zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Su­bhūti, you have asked, ‘From which essential nature do they not waver? ’

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
translated: They do not waver from the essential nature of physical forms.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
translated: He does not move from the essential nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
translated: He does not move from the essential nature of the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
translated: He does not move from the essential nature of the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, or the formless absorptions.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i yan lag brgyad pa'i bar gyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i yan lag brgyad pa'i bar gyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
translated: He does not move from the essential nature of the applications of mindfulness, up to the noble eightfold path.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin @41a *//
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin @41a *//
translated: He does not move from the essential nature of the emptiness meditative stabilization,

original: dang; mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snying rje chen po'i bar gyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: dang; mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snying rje chen po'i bar gyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo'o //
translated: the meditative stabilization of emptiness, the meditative stabilization of signlessness, the meditative stabilization of wishlessness, up to the great compassion.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the intrinsic nature of these dharmas is not a thing.

original: rab 'byor / dngos po med pas ni dngos po med pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po med pas ni dngos po med pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: Subhūti, a non-thing cannot fully awaken to a non-thing.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci dngos po ma mchis pas dngos po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi bar rngo thogs lags sam /
analyzed: ci dngos po ma mchis pas dngos po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi bar rngo thogs lags sam /
translated: can a non-thing fully awaken to a thing?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it cannot.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci dngos pos dngos po ma mchis pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi bar rngo thogs lags sam /
analyzed: ci dngos pos dngos po ma mchis pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi bar rngo thogs lags sam /
translated: can a thing fully awaken to a non-thing?”

original: bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it cannot.”

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is not.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci dngos po ma mchis pas dngos po ma mchis pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi bar rngo thogs lags sam /
analyzed: ci dngos po ma mchis pas dngos po ma mchis pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi bar rngo thogs lags sam /
translated: can non-entity attain manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to non-entity?”

original: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is not.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / ci bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / ci bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dngos pos dngos po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi bar rngo thogs lags sam /
analyzed: dngos pos dngos po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi bar rngo thogs lags sam /
translated: can entity attain manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to entity?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is not.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te dngos po ma mchis pas kyang dngos po mngon par mi rtogs shing /🔽dngos pos kyang dngos po ma mchis pa mngon @41b par mi rtogs la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma mchis pas kyang dngos po mngon par mi rtogs shing / dngos pos kyang dngos po ma mchis pa mngon @41b par mi rtogs la /
translated: if non-entity does not attain manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to entity,🔽and entity does not attain manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to non-entity,

original: dngos po ma mchis pas kyang dngos po ma mchis pa mngon par mi rtogs shing /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pas kyang dngos po ma mchis pa mngon par mi rtogs shing /
translated: and non-entity does not attain manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to non-entity,

original: dngos pos kyang dngos po mngon par rtogs pa ma lags na /
analyzed: dngos pos kyang dngos po mngon par rtogs pa ma lags na /
translated: and entity does not attain manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to entity,

original: 'o na ni thob pa'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: 'o na ni thob pa'ang ma mchis /
translated: then there is neither attainment nor non-attainment.

original: mngon par rtog pa'ang ma mchis par mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: mngon par rtog pa'ang ma mchis par mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: “Lord, will it not be the case that there will be no clear realization?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / mngon par rtogs pa ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mngon par rtogs pa ni yod mod kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, there will be a clear realization,

original: mngon par bsgrub pa 'di bzhis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa 'di bzhis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not through these four accomplishments.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: 'o na mngon par rtogs pa ji lta bu zhig lags /
analyzed: 'o na mngon par rtogs pa ji lta bu zhig lags /
translated: what will the clear realization be like?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: ji ltar dngos po'ang ma yin zhing dngos po med pa'ang ma yin pa de ltar mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba ni mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po'ang ma yin zhing dngos po med pa'ang ma yin pa de ltar mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba ni mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: “It will be like the realization of the sameness of things that are neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: spros pa med cing spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spros pa med cing spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: It is a clear realization in which there is no conceptual elaboration, because it is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: gang la spros pa de dag med pa de lta bu ni mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la spros pa de dag med pa de lta bu ni mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That in which there is no conceptual elaboration is a clear realization.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spros pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spros pa gang lags /
translated: what is the conceptual elaboration of bodhisattva great beings?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
translated: Subhuti: The Bodhisattva's elaboration is the idea that form is permanent or impermanent.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'i //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'i //
translated: The Bodhisattva's elaboration is the idea that feeling, perception, impulse, and consciousness are permanent or impermanent.

original: gzugs bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bde zhes @42a *//
analyzed: gzugs bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bde zhes @42a *//
translated: The Bodhisattva's elaboration is the idea that form is ease or ill.

original: bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva's elaboration is the idea that feeling, perception, impulse, and consciousness are ease or ill.

original: gzugs bdag yod ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag yod ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva's elaboration is the idea that form is self or not self.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yod ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yod ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
translated: “Form is with self’ or ‘form is without self’ is a bodhisattva’s conceptualization.

original: gzugs zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
translated: ‘Form is peace’ or ‘form is not peace’ is a bodhisattva’s conceptualization.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
translated: ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are peace’ or ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not peace’ is a bodhisattva’s conceptualization.

original: gzugs yongs su shes par bya ba yin zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su shes par bya ba yin zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
translated: ‘Form is to be known’ or ‘form is not to be known’ is a bodhisattva’s conceptualization.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par bya ba yin zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par bya ba yin zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spros pa'o //
translated: “The aggregates of sensation, perception, formation, and consciousness are to be fully known” is a bodhisattva’s conceptualization.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yongs su shes par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //🔽kun 'byung ba spang bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yongs su shes par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o // kun 'byung ba spang bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “The noble truth of suffering is to be fully known” is a conceptualization.🔽“The origin of suffering is to be abandoned” is a conceptualization.

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “The cessation of suffering is to be actualized” is a conceptualization.

original: lam bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //🔽bsam gtan bzhi bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //🔽tshad med pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o // bsam gtan bzhi bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o // tshad med pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “The path is to be cultivated” is a conceptualization.🔽“The four concentrations are to be cultivated” is a conceptualization.🔽“The four immeasurables are to be cultivated” is a conceptualization.

original: @42b gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: @42b gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “The four formless absorptions are to be cultivated” is a conceptualization.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path should be cultivated.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: The emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors of liberation should be cultivated.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu bsgom par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: The eight liberations and the nine serial absorptions should be cultivated.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “I will transcend the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, and individual enlightenment.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “I will perfect the ten bodhisattva stages.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “I will enter into the maturity of the bodhisattvas.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “I will purify a buddhafield.”

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “I will bring beings to maturity.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: “I will generate the ten powers of the tathāgatas.”

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @43a *//
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @43a *//
translated: The four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are elaborations.

original: par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: Attaining the knowledge of all aspects is an elaboration.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: Abandoning all residual impression connections is an elaboration.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni spros par bya ba ma yin pa spros par mi byed de /🔽gzugs rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni spros par bya ba ma yin pa spros par mi byed de / gzugs rtag pa'am /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not elaborate what is not to be elaborated.🔽They do not elaborate that form is permanent or

original: mi rtag pa zhes spros par bya ba ma yin pa spros par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes spros par bya ba ma yin pa spros par mi byed do //
translated: impermanent.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams rtag pa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams rtag pa'am /
translated: They do not elaborate that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness are permanent or🔽impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa zhes spros par bya ba ma yin pa spros par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes spros par bya ba ma yin pa spros par mi byed do //
translated: He does not fabricate what is not to be fabricated, namely, the impermanent.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya'o snyam pa'i bar du spros par bya ba ma yin pa spros par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya'o snyam pa'i bar du spros par bya ba ma yin pa spros par mi byed do //
translated: He does not fabricate what is not to be fabricated, up to ‘I will attain the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ni ngo bo nyid spros par mi byed cing /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ni ngo bo nyid spros par mi byed cing /
translated: The intrinsic nature does not fabricate the intrinsic nature.

original: dngos po med pas kyang dngos po spros par mi byed la /
analyzed: dngos po med pas kyang dngos po spros par mi byed la /
translated: A non-entity does not fabricate an entity.

original: ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa ma gtogs par yang gang gis spros par byed pa dang / gang spros par bya ba dang / cis spros par bya ba dang / gang la spros par bya ba gzhan ci'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa ma gtogs par yang gang gis spros par byed pa dang / gang spros par bya ba dang / cis spros par bya ba dang / gang la spros par bya ba gzhan ci'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: Apart from the intrinsic nature and a non-entity, you cannot apprehend anything else that would fabricate, that is fabricated, that is fabricated by that, or that is fabricated in that.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du spros pa med cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du spros pa med cing /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, form up to consciousness is not fabricated,

original: byang chub kyi bar du spros pa med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du spros pa med pa ste /
translated: up to awakening is not fabricated.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos spros pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos spros pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom free of elaborations in that way.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @43b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos thams cad spros pa ma mchis par ji ltar lta bar bgyid lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @43b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos thams cad spros pa ma mchis par ji ltar lta bar bgyid lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom view all phenomena as free of elaborations?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: “Subhūti, the intrinsic nature of form up to consciousness does not exist.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: The intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects does not exist.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de la spros pa med do //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de la spros pa med do //
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature is free of elaborations.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir na gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du spros pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir na gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du spros pa med do //
translated: Subhūti, therefore, form up to consciousness is free of elaborations.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same vein,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du spros pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du spros pa med do //
translated: up to and including omniscience, are free of elaboration.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos gang la'ang ngo bo nyid dmigs su ma mchis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos gang la'ang ngo bo nyid dmigs su ma mchis na /
translated: “Lord, if the intrinsic nature of any dharma is not apprehended,🔽then by what path will bodhisattva great beings enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva—

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nyan thos kyi lam mam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nyan thos kyi lam mam /
translated: the śrāvaka path,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
translated: the pratyekabuddha path,

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /🔽lam gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /🔽lam gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: or the buddha path?”🔽“Subhūti, it is because all paths—🔽the śrāvaka path,🔽the pratyekabuddha path,🔽and the buddha path—

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems @44a *//
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems @44a *//
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: dpa' chen po ni nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la mi 'jug mod kyi /
analyzed: dpa' chen po ni nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la mi 'jug mod kyi /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings do not enter into the maturity of the bodhisattvas through the paths of the śrāvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the buddhas.

original: 'on kyang rab 'byor /
analyzed: 'on kyang rab 'byor /
translated: However, Su­bhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lam thams cad la bslabs nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lam thams cad la bslabs nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: great bodhisattva beings, having trained in all the paths, do enter into the maturity of the bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is just as,

original: dper na / dgra bcom pas lam thams cad la bslabs nas yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / dgra bcom pas lam thams cad la bslabs nas yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug mod kyi /
translated: for example, an arhat, having trained in all the paths, enters into the maturity of the arhat.

original: ji srid du lam gyi 'bras bu ma bskyed pa de srid du lam gyi skad cig la dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du lam gyi 'bras bu ma bskyed pa de srid du lam gyi skad cig la dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, as long as he does not generate the result of the path, he will not attain the result of the arhat in a single moment of the path.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang lam thams cad bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang lam thams cad bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, having generated all the paths, enters into the bodhisattva’s faultlessness.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du /
translated: But until he has attained the vajropama-samādhi,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: he will not attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He will attain the knowledge of all aspects with the wisdom that is possessed of one instant.🔽The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said this to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug na /
translated: If the bodhisattva great being, having completed all the paths, enters into the bodhisattva’s faultlessness,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord!

original: de lta lags na ni brgyad pa'i lam @44b yang gzhan kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta lags na ni brgyad pa'i lam @44b yang gzhan kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, the path of the eighth-lowest stage would be something else,🔽and the path of the pratyekabuddha would be something else,🔽and the path of the bodhisattva would be something else,🔽and the path of the Buddha would be something else.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /🔽lan gcig phyir 'ong ba la zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba la zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /
translated: The path of the stream enterer is one thing,🔽the path of the one who has entered the result of once-returner is another,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i lam yang gzhan /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba la zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam yang gzhan /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i lam yang gzhan / phyir mi 'ong ba la zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan / phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam yang gzhan /
translated: the path of the once-returner is another,🔽the path of the one who has entered the result of non-returner is another,

original: dgra bcom pa la zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /
translated: the path of the non-returner is another,🔽the path of the one who has entered the result of arhat is another,

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam yang gzhan /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam yang gzhan /
translated: the path of the arhat is another,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang gzhan /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang gzhan /
translated: the path of the pratyekabuddha is another,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam yang gzhan du mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam yang gzhan du mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: and the path of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas is another?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te lam de dag phan tshun tha dad par gyur na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: gal te lam de dag phan tshun tha dad par gyur na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: if those paths are mutually distinct, how could great bodhisattva beings, having perfected all the paths, enter into the maturity of the bodhisattvas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi 'tshal bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi 'tshal bar gyur na /
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva is one who should perfect all paths,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad bskyed pas brgyad par mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad bskyed pas brgyad par mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: then, Blessed One, would a bodhisattva mahāsattva not become an eighth-level practitioner by generating all paths?

original: mthong ba'i lam bskyed pas rgyun du zhugs par mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bskyed pas rgyun du zhugs par mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: Would he not become a stream enterer by generating the path of seeing?

original: bsgom pa'i lam bskyed pas lan gcig phyir 'ong ba la zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong bar mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam bskyed pas lan gcig phyir 'ong ba la zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong bar mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: Would he not become a once-returner or a non-returner by generating the path of meditation?

original: dgra bcom pa'i bar du'ang mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i bar du'ang mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: Would he not become a worthy one?

original: @45a *// rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bskyed pas rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: @45a *// rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bskyed pas rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: Would he not become a pratyekabuddha by generating the path of a pratyekabuddha?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos brgyad pa'i lam bskyed pas brgyad par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos brgyad pa'i lam bskyed pas brgyad par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: would a bodhisattva mahāsattva become an eighth-level practitioner by generating the path of an eighth-level practitioner?

original: brgyad par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa de ni gnas ma mchis shing skabs ma lags te /
analyzed: brgyad par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa de ni gnas ma mchis shing skabs ma lags te /
translated: It is not possible for one who has become an arhat to enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: de ni gnas ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma mchis lags so //
translated: That is not possible.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bgyi ba de ni gnas ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bgyi ba de ni gnas ma mchis lags so //
translated: Having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, to attain the knowledge of all aspects is not possible.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'am /
translated: Similarly, having attained the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub kyi bar du thob nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug ces bgyi ba de ni gnas ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: rang byang chub kyi bar du thob nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug ces bgyi ba de ni gnas ma mchis lags so //
translated: or even having attained a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, to enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva is not possible.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bgyi ba de ni gnas ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bgyi ba de ni gnas ma mchis lags na /
translated: Having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, to attain the knowledge of all aspects is not possible.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: ji ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob cing /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob cing /
translated: “How should I, a bodhisattva great being, generate all the paths, enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva, and, having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, attain the knowledge of all aspects

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar 'tshal bar bgyi lags /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar 'tshal bar bgyi lags /
translated: and abandon all residual impressions, connections, and afflictive emotions?”

original: de skad ces @45b gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de skad ces @45b gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord said to the venerable Subhūti,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brgyad par gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brgyad par gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, it is not possible that a bodhisattva great being, having become an eighth-level [Śrāvaka],

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob nas lam thams cad bskyed de /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob nas lam thams cad bskyed de /
translated: having attained the result of stream enterer, having generated all the paths,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug ces bya ba ni gnas med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug ces bya ba ni gnas med do //
translated: and having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: skabs ma yin zhing de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: skabs ma yin zhing de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is not the right time for that, and there is no place for it.🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: “It is impossible and cannot happen that someone who has entered the secure state of a bodhisattva will attain the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa na /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having raised their first thought of awakening, practicing the six perfections,

original: shes pa dang / mthong bas sa brgyad po dag la rnam par bltas nas 'da' bar byed de /
analyzed: shes pa dang / mthong bas sa brgyad po dag la rnam par bltas nas 'da' bar byed de /
translated: having looked with their knowledge and seeing with their eyes, go beyond the eight levels.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa dang / rigs kyis dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa can gyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa dang / rigs kyis dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa can gyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
translated: the level of seeing what is white, the level of lineage, the eighth-lowest level, the level of seeing, the level of thinning, the level of separation from desire, the level of being skilled in means, and the pratyekabuddha level.

original: 'di ni sar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching on the levels.

original: des shes pa dang / mthong bas sa brgyad po de dag las 'das par byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: des shes pa dang / mthong bas sa brgyad po de dag las 'das par byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: Having transcended those eight stages through that knowledge and that vision, he enters into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong ngo //🔽rab 'byor / de la brgyad pa'i @46a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong ngo // rab 'byor / de la brgyad pa'i @46a *//
translated: Having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, he abandons all the afflictions, latencies, and connections through the knowledge of a tathāgata.

original: shes pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //🔽lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o // rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the knowledge of the eighth-lowest stage is the acceptance of a bodhisattva.🔽The knowledge and abandonment of a stream enterer is the acceptance of a bodhisattva.🔽The knowledge and abandonment of a once-returner is the acceptance of a bodhisattva.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of a non-returner is the acceptance of a bodhisattva.

original: dgra bcom pa'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of an arhat is the acceptance of a bodhisattva.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of a pratyekabuddha is the acceptance of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lam de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lam de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: Having completed all those paths of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattva enters into the bodhisattva’s faultlessness by means of the knowledge of the aspect of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ste /
translated: Having entered into the bodhisattva’s faultlessness, by means of the knowledge of the knowledge of all aspects, he abandons all the latent states, connections, and afflictions.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
translated: Having fully known the path of the Bodhisattvas, he should fully know the knowledge of all modes.

original: bla na med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'bras bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi 'tshor bar 'gyur @46b ro; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bla na med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'bras bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi 'tshor bar 'gyur @46b ro; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having fully known the knowledge of all modes, he should demonstrate Dharma to beings in accordance with their aspirations.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.🔽Subhuti: What is the path of the Disciples, what is the path of the Pratyekabuddhas, what is the path of the Buddhas?

original: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i lam gang lags pa 'di dag las bcom ldan 'das lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam gang lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i lam gang lags pa 'di dag las bcom ldan 'das lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam gang lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord: The path of the Disciples is the path of the knowledge of all modes, the path of the Pratyekabuddhas is the path of the knowledge of all modes, the path of the Buddhas is the path of the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti: Here the Bodhisattva, the great being, should produce the purity of the knowledge of the modes of the path.

original: rab 'byor / de la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa ni 'di yin te /🔽rnam pa gang dang gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dang gang dag dang / rtags gang dang gang dag gis lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dag par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dang de dag dang / mtshan ma de dang de dag dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa ni 'di yin te / rnam pa gang dang gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dang gang dag dang / rtags gang dang gang dag gis lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dag par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dang de dag dang / mtshan ma de dang de dag dang /
translated: Subhuti: Here the purity of the knowledge of the modes of the path is this:

original: rtags de dang de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya'o //🔽mngon par rdzogs par rtogs nas kyang gzhan gdul ba'i phyir ci nas pha rol gyi khong du chud par gzhan dag la brjod par bya /🔽bstan par bya /🔽bshad par bya /
analyzed: rtags de dang de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya'o // mngon par rdzogs par rtogs nas kyang gzhan gdul ba'i phyir ci nas pha rol gyi khong du chud par gzhan dag la brjod par bya / bstan par bya / bshad par bya /
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, should fully know those modes, those signs, those tokens by which the knowledge of the modes of the path is purified.🔽Having fully known them, he should proclaim them to others, he should teach them, he should announce them, he should set them forth, he should make them known, he should make them manifest, he should point them out, he should explain them, he should make them clearly appear.

original: gdags par bya /🔽dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gdags par bya /🔽dgod par bya'o //
translated: For the conversion of others.

original: de la skad dang / brda dang / sgra gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dbyangs kyis go bar 'gyur ba'i skad dang / brda dang / sgra thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de la skad dang / brda dang / sgra gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dbyangs kyis go bar 'gyur ba'i skad dang / brda dang / sgra thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should master all the languages, signs, and sounds by which the great billionfold world system understands speech,

original: brag ca lta bur rtogs par bya ba'i phyir @47a *//🔽bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: brag ca lta bur rtogs par bya ba'i phyir @47a *// bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: in order to realize them to be like an echo.🔽They should master them in order to realize them to be like an apparition.🔽“Subhūti, for these reasons bodhisattva great beings should complete the knowledge of path aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya'o; ;lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya'o; ;lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having completed the knowledge of path aspects,

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes par bya'o //
translated: they should know the thoughts of beings.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
translated: They should know the path of beings in the hells,

original: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
analyzed: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
translated: they should know the cause,

original: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya ste /
translated: and they should know the result.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i lam de las bzlog par bya /🔽rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i lam de las bzlog par bya / rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya /
translated: I will turn them away from the path of the hells.🔽I will turn them away from the causes of the hells.

original: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: I will turn them away from the results of the hells.

original: de bzhin du dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi lam las kyang bzlog par bya /🔽rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi lam las kyang bzlog par bya / rgyu las kyang bzlog par bya /
translated: In the same way, I will turn them away from the path of the animal world.🔽I will turn them away from the causes of the animal world.

original: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las kyang bzlog par bya'o //
translated: I will turn them away from the results of the animal world.

original: mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / mi rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
analyzed: mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / mi rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
translated: I will know the paths of the gandharvas, the mahoragas, the nāgas, the yakṣas, and humans.

original: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
analyzed: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
translated: I will know their causes.

original: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //
translated: I will know their results.

original: lha rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
translated: I will know the paths of the gods.

original: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
analyzed: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
translated: I will know their causes.

original: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //
translated: I will know their results.

original: tshangs pa'i lam yang shes par bya /🔽rgyu'ang shes par bya /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i lam yang shes par bya / rgyu'ang shes par bya /
translated: I will know the path of Brahmā.🔽I will know its causes.

original: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //
translated: I will know its results.

original: 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / 'du shes med pa rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / 'du shes med pa rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
translated: the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the gods of Joyous Heaven, the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, the gods of the Brahma Heavens, the gods of Limited Radiance, the gods of Immeasurable Radiance, the gods of Luminous Radiance, the gods of Limited Virtue, the gods of Immeasurable Virtue, the gods of Flourishing Virtue, the gods of Great Fruit, the gods of No Perception, the gods of No Great Suffering, the gods of No Heat, and the gods of Supreme Peak.

original: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
analyzed: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
translated: “They should know their causes,

original: 'bras @47b bu'ang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras @47b bu'ang shes par bya'o //
translated: and they should know their results.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
translated: “They should know the path of the gods of the Sphere of Infinite Space,

original: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
analyzed: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
translated: they should know its causes,

original: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //🔽'du shes med /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o // 'du shes med /
translated: and they should know its results.🔽“They should know the path of the gods of the Sphere of Infinite Consciousness,🔽the Sphere of Nothingness,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi lha rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i bar gyi lha rnams kyi lam yang shes par bya /
translated: and the Sphere of Neither Perception nor Non-perception,

original: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
analyzed: rgyu'ang shes par bya /
translated: they should know their causes,

original: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang shes par bya'o //
translated: and they should know their results.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi shes par bya /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi shes par bya /
translated: “They should know the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi shes par bya /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi shes par bya /
translated: the four right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi shes par bya /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi shes par bya /
translated: and the four legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po lnga shes par bya /
analyzed: dbang po lnga shes par bya /
translated: The five faculties.🔽

original: stobs lnga shes par bya /
analyzed: stobs lnga shes par bya /
translated: “They should know the five powers.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun shes par bya /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun shes par bya /
translated: They should know the seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes par bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes par bya /
translated: They should know the noble eightfold path.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid shes par bya /🔽rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa shes par bya /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid shes par bya / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa shes par bya /
translated: They should know the emptiness gate of liberation.🔽They should know the signlessness gate of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa shes par bya /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa shes par bya /
translated: They should know the wishlessness gate of liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes par bya /
translated: They should know the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi shes par bya /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi shes par bya /
translated: They should know the four fearlessnesses.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi shes par bya /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi shes par bya /
translated: They should know the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad shes par bya; snying rje chen po shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad shes par bya; snying rje chen po shes par bya'o //
translated: They should know the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha. They should know great compassion.

original: lam de dag gis kyang sems can rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god do //
analyzed: lam de dag gis kyang sems can rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god do //
translated: “Those beings who should be placed in the result of stream enterer by that path are placed in the result of stream enterer.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar la dgod par bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar la dgod par bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god do //
translated: those who should be established in the fruit of arhatship are established in the fruit of arhatship;

original: rang byang chub la dgod par bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni rang byang chub la 'god do //🔽byang chub @48a *//
analyzed: rang byang chub la dgod par bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni rang byang chub la 'god do // byang chub @48a *//
translated: those who should be established in individual enlightenment are established in individual enlightenment;

original: la dgod par bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni byang chub la 'god de /
analyzed: la dgod par bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni byang chub la 'god de /
translated: those who should be established in perfect enlightenment are established in perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: This, Subhūti, is the knowledge of path aspects of bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de la bslabs nas sems can gyi bsam pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de la bslabs nas sems can gyi bsam pa la 'jug go /
translated: Having trained in it, bodhisattva great beings enter into the thoughts of beings.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa la zhugs nas ci nas de'i chos bstan pa chud mi za zhing don yod par 'gyur ba de lta bur chos ston to //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa la zhugs nas ci nas de'i chos bstan pa chud mi za zhing don yod par 'gyur ba de lta bur chos ston to //
translated: Having entered into the thoughts of beings, they teach the Dharma in such a way that the Dharma teaching is not wasted and is not fruitless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de ni pha rol gyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa shin tu bye brag phyed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni pha rol gyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa shin tu bye brag phyed cing /
translated: Because they have thoroughly distinguished the knowledge of the higher and lower faculties of others.

original: shin tu rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is very well understood.

original: des ni sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: des ni sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: By means of it, the coming and going, the passing away and being born of beings is known just as it is.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gang dag la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bslab par bya ba dang / nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bslab par bya ba'i lam thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i nang du 'dus pas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gang dag la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bslab par bya ba dang / nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bslab par bya ba'i lam thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i nang du 'dus pas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, since all the paths on which the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should train, and on which the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas should train, are included in this perfection of wisdom, the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽When this was said, the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord!

original: gal te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams gang lags pa dang / byang chub gang lags pa'i chos de dag ldan @48b pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: gal te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams gang lags pa dang / byang chub gang lags pa'i chos de dag ldan @48b pa'ang ma lags /
